Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: DonPrice
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews I will just echo the positives about location (with special emphasis on the nearby tram stop--easy cheap transport to metro or Beyoglu side or Eminonu ferries, tours), terrace breakfasts, very reasonable price, etc. We didn't mind climbing stairs (staff will help with getting heavy luggage up if necessary) and found no problem with plumbing. Most important is staff. Baris was tremendously helpful in dealing with our evolving reservations, week-long storage of luggage, arrangement of airport transport. It will definitely be our first choice if we return. Book in advance! It's in high demand. D & N Price, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - much better then expected”
Reviews.Author: Elmina_M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose to stay at Hanedan during our vacation based on very good reviews we found here. It turned out to be excellent choice. Great location, professional staff, very clean and comfortable room and overall cozy and friendly atmosphere in the hotel made our stay in Istanbul really pleasant and unforgettable. After six nights spent there we can confirm that Hanedan is really good basic hotel, maybe one of the best buy in this category. They offer clean, safe and friendly accommodation, no luxuries, but you will definitely not be disappointed. We look forward to stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Joana B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is locate near all the most important places to go and surrounded by many options of restaurants and mini markets. The terrace - where breakfast is served - has a beautiful view to the Bosforo. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Only tiny downs sides are: there are no elevator and they are not very fast in replacing food at breakfast - which means waking up late is not a good idea..

Reviews.Title: “Warm atmosphere&great location”
Reviews.Author: Asia_PL83
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at the Hanedan hotel with my boyfriend in March 2011. We were very unlucky with the weather as it was really cold and rainy in Istanbul that month! When we arrived we were showed to our room which was quite small but rather cozy. It had a big double bed, a tv, small bathroom and an electric tea maker. I was coming down with the flu and asked the owner to put up the heating in our bedroom which he did immediately. You'll find the owner to be a warm and friendly person, always ready to help out. The whole place has a hostel feel to it: there are loads of guidebooks downstairs which can help you plan your stay better and the staff are nice and chatty. Despite the cold weather and my flu I loved staying at the Hanedan hotel. The view from the terrace where you have breakfast is amazing and you can walk to the main attractions in a matter of minutes.Book this hotel in advance as it's always full and no wonder!The only downside: thin walls!However I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay with Excellent and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hanedan Hotel. The location is great, walking distance to many of the major sites of Istanbul. Th staff is very friendly and this is what made our stay memorable. Baris, at reception, was our contact at the hotel and he answered all our questions and he was extremely helpful with giving directions and making suggestions with places to visit. The rooms are newly renovated and clean and the hotel rates are fairly priced for what is offered, clean rooms, friendly staff and breakfasts are included. Also the management provides a reliable taxi service from the airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value with great service; Baris is a great host!”
Reviews.Author: KeenanJohnston
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and cannot recommend a hotel more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and perfectly located!”
Reviews.Author: llw28
Reviews.Content: Hanedan is a no-frills hotel but one of the best I've stayed in. We had a warm welcome from Borish and settled well in to our clean, light and comfortable room. The bed was comfortable- not too soft, not too hard and the sheets were crisp and fresh. Bathroom lovely (although we had a temperamental hot water tap in the shower... either freezing or boiling... or you caught the 30 second switch over when the water was just right!), safe in the wardrobe etc- all the things you'll need. There was also a flashy looking TV in the room, but when you're in a city like Istanbul, who wants to watch TV?!! The breakfasts were, as I undersatnd it, traditionally Turkish. It was like a buffet of assorted breakfast items, with a few lunch items in there too! Jam, bread, eggs, olives, cheese rolls (homemade) and fresh coffee and juices. It is served from 8am until 11am, so get there not too late to not miss out! The first day we went to breakfast at 10am or so, and there was one bread roll left! The kitchen and dining room area is on the roof, which offers BRILLIANT views one way over the Bospherous (a great view to start the day), and Ayia Sophia the other way. Being on the roof also gives you a great opportunity to take in the higgledy-piggeldy rooflines of this city! Hanedan is ideally located for all the major sites. After the first day, we walked everywhere... no need to get trams and taxis etc (although public transport is very close and easy to use)- and walking is a great way to see Istanbul! There's a road next to Hanedan that has an assortment of bars and restaurants, which offer evening excitement if that's what you're looking for. We could hear it going on, but only on the Saturday evening- we stayed Weds-Sun, so it wasn't a big deal to hear noise in a city for one night only. Hanedan was great and we'd recommend it! My only suggestion for Hanedan is that the lady who sets up breakfast wear softer soled shoes and her clicking heels walking around woke us every morning at 630! But really, if that and the shower are my only downsides... it means this place is good! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Boeing777
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights here and will be back for another 3. In my opinion, this is a great mid range accomodation in Sultanahmet. Hagia sophia and the blue mosque is walking distance away. Tram stop is a few minutes away as well. Now to the room, I booked a single but was given a double upon arrival. It was spotlessly clean with crisp white linen and heating is cracked up high. Ensuite bathroom is again spotlessly clean. Breakfast is served at the rooftop terrace with view towards the Bhosporous and Hagia sofia and across to the four seasons sultanahmet hotel. Generous choices of bread, egg, yogurt etc. Good filter coffee and tea is served with breakfast. Barish the gentleman working the front desk during the day is both professional and friendly. There is a laptop available for guests use. Left my shopping there for safe keeping while I enjoy the rest of this wonderful country. I came here without any plans, Barish put me in touch with Bonita tours next door. They arranged everything for me from accomodation, flights, tours etc. Quality of the tour is pretty good so far, they use reputable travels agency througout the country. I have just finished the cappadocian part of the journey and is glad to report they deliver what they sold you. For a mid range accomodation in Sultanahmet part of the city, I cannot recommend Hanedan enough based on what I have experienced. A well run and very well maintained property. You cannot go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “I really loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KATHRIN G
Reviews.Content: It's near Blue Mosque, Ayia Sofia, Top capi. It's only 5-10 minutes walking! It's very sweet, clean, the services are great. You eat your breakfast with the excellent view of Marmara sea!!!!It's really cheap! I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: GreatDane607
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed reservation with an airport pickup. I had informed them that I would take some time to get a visa so the driver will need to factor that in. Inspite of that, the driver left without me. I waited at the airport with my wife and 5 year old child trying to call these people. Ofcourse, making a phone call from Istanbul is like pulling teeth - you cant use coins - you have to buy a stupid calling card from the post office at the other end of the airport. When the driver showed up after an hour, he was incredibly rude. This person was not an employee of the hotel but that does not help me. Breakfast at the hotel was very good. Plumbing is messed up - when you are showering, the water varies between cold and hot. Rooms are tiny. Not the best when you are with a child.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, with value pricing”
Reviews.Author: Bikergrrls
Reviews.Content: I showed up in Istanbul without a reservation. After looking at rooms at two other places, I settled on Hanedan. The employees provided exceptional service, helped call for evening show reservations, lent me a laptop to check email on, and provided a good breakfast buffet. The location is convenient to tourist restaurants and several main tourist sites, such as Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Blue Mosque, and the Cisterns. To get to less touristy restaurants requires a bit of a walk or tram ride. Like most hotels in the area, Hanedan is close to a mosque, so there are early morning wake-up calls to prayer! I would have stayed at Hanedan on my return trip through Istanbul, but I arrived early, before the front door was unlocked.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service and good value”
Reviews.Author: Veneralawrence
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel for a long weekend stay and to someone who is planning a dynamic holiday. Modest and clean and with remarkable service (Marash, Aeron thank you!) and beautiful sea view from the breakfast roof terrace. There you will enjoy home made cakes and cheese cookies. Quiet located in the heart of the historic area next to all museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great and warm stay @ Hanedan :)”
Reviews.Author: Edwin K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a really memorable stay at Hanedan Hotel, where we also shuffled back and forth with their sister hotel, the Peninsula due to the length of our stay (3 weeks thereabouts). The breakfast was fantastic at both places, with a great view of the Marmara Sea on the terrace during the mornings. Kudos to the team of Abdullah, Bahatin, Ziki, and the rest for being so accommodating and sharing their knowledge of where to get the best lokum :) as well as pointers for a reliable travel agency (say Hi to Janel for us!), in addition to any other questions that we had concerning the great, historical city of Istanbul. We do hope to return to Turkey sometime in the future for another dream trip...God bless you all!

Reviews.Title: “Consider this hotel when staying in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: misty12312
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, Great Staff. Great Location. Great Value.

Reviews.Title: “Back in Sultanhamet - Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: walterm3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hanedan Hotel for three nights in September. This is our second visit to Sultanhamet - last year we stayed at the Hotel Peninsula across the street and enjoyed our visit very much. We decided to try the Hanedan just for a change and found this hotel to be a very nice well run hotel and a fair price. We were upgraded to a family room and really enjoyed the extra room. The room was simple but nicely decorated and had a tv (most channels in Turkish but enjoyed all the sports broadcasts) and a hot water kettle which was very handy. The room was very clean and well kept. The rooftop terrace has an awesome view. We found Erhan who was always available in reception to be very helpful and fluent in English and able to answer all our questions. The Hanedan is on a quieter little side street and in a very convenient spot for sight seeing - besides the big sights which are really close, a 5-10min walk to the tram will get you to other parts of the city. It is really easy and inexpensive to take the tram then transfer to the Metro to get to the airport (unless you have to leave really really early) We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: RobVan888
Reviews.Content: If you only have a few days to enjoy Istanbul "Old Town" this is a perfect location. You are only a few blocks from all the major sights and restaurants. Erhan was incredibly helpful with all of questions regarding tours etc. As we arrived at midnight, the pick-up at the airport was a nice touch. The breakfast on the rooftop is a wonderful way to begin your day as you enjoy the early morning sunshine. The rooms are not fancy, but are very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Spacemoth
Reviews.Content: Hanedan is a great choice in Sultanahmet. Located in a quiet side street, it's just a five minute walk from all the historical sights - Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, etc. The staff are extremely friendly, the rooms comfortable and the view from the rooftop terrace, where breakfast is served, is spectacular. The transfer service they offer to and from the airport is also really worth the money as the streets in this area are a bit difficult to negotiate and the public transport options a bit uncomfortable, especially with bags.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Istanbul stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveIntlTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hanedan for six days while in Istanbul for a conference. I would not go anywhere else, because it has -- Wonderfully attentive and helpful staff, especially Erhan Orkun, who helped with everything from lending me a laptop in the wee hours to calling places where they only spoke Turkish, on his own cell phone!; The perfect location, a short block from the Four Seasons and a two-minute walk to Aya Sofyia and the Blue Mosque; A terrace with jaw-dropping views of the two monuments above and the Marmara Sea; Lovely rooms with sophisticated antique details (like a four-poster bed), no noise and air-conditioning, all at a budget hotel price. I am still shocked that I had the good luck of finding rooms at short notice -- the hotel was always full--and I will definitely return if in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: porterjames2
Reviews.Content: Our family rented a room for 5. Although small (as expected for 5 people) the room was clean and comfortable. The bath was small but everything functioned well. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was one of the best we found in our around the world trip. One of our family members is vegetarian and had no trouble. The location is outstanding and the view from the roof top eating area is stunning. A small store is around the corner offering wine and cold beer. The hotel arranged airport pickup at 20 Euros (for 5 people- not each), which is better than other shuttle services or taxi rates. We all loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: aimeekm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I, two women in our thirties had a wonderful experience at Hanedan. I had reserved a double room for we were instead put into a family room! It was the beginning of a really terrific stay. The room was large and bright; spotlessly clean w wood floors and crisp white sheets. The bathroom was far roomier than average, important w 2 women in a room. Iâ€™m picky about showers, this one had a marble floor, good water pressure & plentiful hot water, I was a VERY happy camper! But the best part of the Hanedan is their staff (high praise considering how much I prize a great shower!). Abdullah at the front desk was always a friendly face and happy to expertly answer any question we might have. Abdullah and Zeki, on the night desk, made our Hanedan experience really amazing by making us feel like old friends arriving home every night. There is a beautiful beautiful view from Hanedanâ€™s roof terrace, amazing. Not only is breakfast served there, but it is open 24 hours for guest. It became our nearly nightly ritual to have a night cap on the terrace and soak in the view. The breakfast is a very nice spread w meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, cucumbers, tomatoes, yogurt w jams, fresh cakes and breads. The yougurt, jams, bread and cakes were all freshly made. Hanedan also arranged our airport pick up and drop off to both IST & SAW. It was priced better than other private transfers, and it was smooth and flawless. I really couldn't ask for anything more from a hotel. And yo get it all for such a low price is truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rasmanrulz
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our fantastic stay at the Hanedan in Istanbul. The first thing I would say is the location is absolutely perfect. It is literally a stones throw from the hagia sophia, blue mosque and topkapi palace. It also has many great bars and nice restaurants on it's doorstep. The staff we very helpful and friendly. On our first night we were awoken by a leak in the toilet pipe in our room (it sounded like the shower was on). The staff were really helpful, turned the water off and moved us to a new room for the night. The next day they had replaced the pipe and we were able to stay in our room again. The roof terrace view was fantastic and the view of the hagia sophia was terrific. Our only slight critism was that the bathroom was a bit naff. It was clean but as well as the toilet problem the tap was quite tempermental! We had a fantastic time in an amazing city and I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a tad expensive”
Reviews.Author: rads_6
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean, spacious rooms with excellent views, and sumptuous breakfast. We paid 60 Euro a night. Next door to the Hanedan is the Hotel Peninsula (a sister hotel of Hanedan) which we also stayed at. Same breakfast, same views, as nice, if not better rooms, and about 10 Euro cheaper. Still, a good option if the Peninsula is not available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ospitalitÃ , great position and nice terrace”
Reviews.Author: Massi_moomissam
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights and we really enjoyed the courtesy and kindness of hoteliers (Zeki was a great advisor). The rooms are clean and confortable even if rather . We really loved the hotel position and the view from the terrace where we enjoyed the breakfast. The position is really good: in 5 minutes walk you are at Blue Mosque, saint sophia and Topkapi palace.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SwissgirlVienna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Sulthanament part of Istanbul and very close to the main sights and public transport. The area is noisy (music, restaurants), but the windows have very goog isolation and there is also an a/c in the rooms (we didn't use it). The breakfast is ok, the view from the roof top terrace is pretty nice. There is free wifi on every floor of the hotel. The guys at the reception desk are nice, maybe a bit too nice to three ladies... They lost our key (it fall of the key hanger between desk and wall) and first they didn't believe us we gave them our key in the morning. Then they suspected the cleaning guy lost it. Finally (after several hours...) my friend spotted the key between the desk and the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, good value!”
Reviews.Author: RMerel
Reviews.Content: We're a senior couple, our first trip to Istanbul, stayed for 7 days. Zeki & the staff are very helpful, "When you're happy, I'm happy!", giving good advice re transport. Very good bkfst included, on roof w/ panoramic Bosporus view. Location is great. Rooms are small & spare, but comfortable. Only one chair. Bring your own shampoo. No lift. Hotel is quiet, but the area, central in Sultanamet, is noisy at night w/music. But it's quiet by 11:30. Windows can be closed for good insulation. It's very good value, 60â‚¬, cash / night. When we had minor problems with the room, they responded quickly, made it right. Free wifi all thru hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: burat187291
Reviews.Content: WOW!! This came recommended and it was well worth it. The location is close to the Hagia, Train Station, and Blue Mosque. It is just off a beautiful street of restaurants and bars with great sea view of the bosphorous and Hagia. But best of all was the staff, Zeki and Baris were the greatest, so helpful and they went out of thier way to make sure thier customers had a great vacation inside and outside the hotel. Super Service!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Your address in Istanbul : Hanedan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: disposablephotograph
Reviews.Content: It is an exciting city break destination: Istanbul. Istanbul is a fascinating and vibrant city full of wonderful sights and many things to do.I chose Hanedan Hotel due to its good reviews and excellent position almost in the centre of the old town.. Everywhere I wanted to visit was within a few minutes walk and for my needs this hotel certainly seemed to be the best placed of any in Istanbul. Fantastic breakfast on top floor with great views over town and sea, and the staff and the reception desk are muti- lingual and friendly particularly Zeki who was very helpfull and very knowledgeable. I enjoyed talking to all of them ,I felt I was at home, and very welcomed. I will definitely stay again if i visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Russjack
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Abdullah, Zeki, and all the staff. They went out of their way to help us with tips, advise, and travel plans. The breakfast staff was friendly and the food was fresh and good. The rooms were spotless and quiet, considering you are in the heart of the city. Location is perfect, being in the old part of town, near all the sights. We left feeling as though we were leaving friends. We really only have good things to say about the Hanedan, and will probably stay there again when we return to Turkey, which we hope is sooner rather than later. Russ and Carmen Jackson, Bellingham, Wa. USA

Reviews.Title: “Warm place, friendly staff, good price”
Reviews.Author: Katadikos
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Hanedan before 2 weeks with a friend. The room and bathroom were very clean. The hotel was perfectly situated - maybe a 5 minute walk - near the main attractions in Sultanahmet - Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Serayi and also close to the tram. The rooftop terrace was great and on the mornings I was up and awake by 8 was able to enjoy breakfast overlooking the Bosphorus. The breakfast was simple but delicious and the coffee or the tea served by a very beautiful womanâ€¦ :) The best part of the Hanedan was the guys at the front desk ( Abdullah and Zeki )! With honest critiques of places to visit, very helpful and very kind. We become friends and I invite them to Greece. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for tourists, good management”
Reviews.Author: sea-lon-sf
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is very good for first-time visitors to Istanbul as it's easy to walk to some of the major sights. The room was adequate. Small. Bathroom smelled a bit and our view was not good. But overall adequate. The buffet breakfast was good and I appreciated having filter coffee instead of Nescafe. There were two kinds of olives, bread, hard boiled eggs, cheese, fruit, fruit spreads, honey and a few other items (typical Turkish breakfast). The view at breakfast is very good. During our stay, we had some cold days but even if you're inside, there are windows all around so you can enjoy the view. We never felt rushed at breakfast and there was always a place to sit. The manager of the hotel was always there and very helpful - he was the best part of the whole Hanedan experience. He suggested a traditional hamam that we thoroughly enjoyed and suggested itineraries for us - very helpful and it was appreciated. We emailed the hotel before our stay and always received prompt replies. We set up a ride from the airport through the hotel but when we arrived, no one was there to pick us up. We checked back three times but did not see anyone so took a taxi in. We found out when we arrived at the hotel that a driver was at the airport waiting for us. Perhaps he was late? We'll never know, but he was not there when we arrived. Regardless, the taxi in was not very expensive so I would not suggest using the pickup service. Overall, a pleasant stay and value for money but don't expect a fresh-smelling boutique hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, Great Value, excellent staff.....loved it”
Reviews.Author: Usiddiqui
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that we chose this hotel. It is very close to all the attractions. It was also next to all the restaurants. Most of the B&Bs and hotels are on that restaurant street, the restaurant on the ground floor and the hotel on top. As you can imagine it gets very noisy at night.This B&B is the first building as you turn from that busy street and there is no restaurant onthe ground floor....so you get the best of both. Stafff was very helpfull and friendly. My kids are 13, 10 and 8. They would spend most of the time with the manager, could easily go the restaurant which was next door and order their hot chocolates! Rooms are small but that is expected in this old district. Beds are comfy. Bathrooms are attached, small nothing grand but serve the purpose. Breakfast on the roof top was excellent. Breathtaking views of the sea. All in all...excellent value for money. I

Reviews.Title: “Great room, perfect location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: KLJK
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and myself stayed at this hotel in march and loved it. Breakfasts were fresh and satisfying with the breakfast room giving an amazing view of Istanbul and down to the water. Our triple room was lovely and spacious... immaculate too! Location was great as it is a short walk from Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia but far enough away from the central area to get rest and silence in the evenings. Staff was nice and accomodating (especially when we forgot something and they mailed it to our home free of charge!) Great stay, would love to return and definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: HanneloreGroningen
Reviews.Content: Staff and housekeeper helpful and friendly. Rooms clean. Location perfect --> shop (for water, fruit etc. etc.) around the corner, a great variety of restaurants around the other corner, tram-stop within walking distance (7 minutes), cab-rank: a 3 minutes walk, the well-known highlights of Sultanahmet within walking-distance, what else do you want. The hotel is in a cosy small street, a tree and some shrubs give a good feeling, and thanks to the many restaurants it's a lively neighbourhood. An advice: don't forget your earplugs as there is a kind of discobar close to the restaurant.. Nevertheless: we enjoyed our stay at the Hanedan hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good one, I would recommend this”
Reviews.Author: anis79
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place near all the main sights as other reviewers have mentioned and in a safe area, which was important for a solo female like me. Restaurants and cafes were just a few steps away, so food was never a problem. Rooms were clean with a hot shower and a comfortable bed which I always looked forward to crashing into on the four nights that I stayed here. Staff members were also helpful and attentive. Towels and toiletries are all included, though the bathroom could do with more hooks or railings to hang clothes or damp towels, but honestly speaking that wasn't a big deal because there were coat hangers in the bedroom. Other than that, everything else was perfect. What I liked best- quiet area, free wifi in rooms, great value and service and cosy, tastefully-decorated rooms. What I liked least- no complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, no credit card”
Reviews.Author: Bebadosamba
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for four night in early February. The hotel is nice with polite staff if not particularly friendly. Rooms are spacious and clean. Overall the only con I would mention is that although they say credit cards are accepted on their website, they make a hard time to take it... I had to pay in cash and to top that they used a outrageous 2.16 EURO-TURK. LIRA exchange rate (room prices are announced in euros) even though it was them that would not take the credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for enjoyable time.”
Reviews.Author: sea_deniz
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel without reservation in the morning, Hanedan's staff showed us into the room kindly, and then we could have breakfast with some fresh fruits and bread so on until eleven o'clock. The view from the terrace where breakfast is served, on the one hand was Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque, and the other hand was the Sea of Marmara. The room was not wide but comfortable, with hot water shower, beds good to sleep and central heating, besides always be clean. We could go to see the sights on foot,for example Aya sophia, Blue Mosque, Yere Batan, Topkapu Salayu and Grand Bazaar. If you want to go to somewhere in the new area of Europe or the area of Asia, you walk to Sultan-Ahmet station in 5-10 mins and go by tram. Staffs were very kind and very friendly, so we spent comfortable vacation there. Thanks for enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jax36
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hanedan in December and really can't fault it. The rooms are clean and comfortable and warm (it was cold and wet while we were there, although it didn't spoil our trip), no noise, friendly helpful staff, great view of the Bosphorous from the breakfast room/roof, no rip offs. I think you can trust the people here. The pick up from the Airport was a reasonable price and was waiting for us and no fuss as was the taxi we booked through the hotel to the bus station. Exellent value, after all you are right in the centre of the most touristed part of Istanbul, great location right next to Aghia Sophia and the Blue mosque. Good restaurants not far away. I'd definitely stay here again. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great breakfast, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rabiar
Reviews.Content: Around a 10-15 (uphill) walk to the Blue Mosque and where all the action is. Surrounded by restaurants and vendors. Easy to arrange transport from airport. once you're there, you can arrange easier and cheaper shuttle back to the airport Awesome breakfast every AM on rooftop terrace. very nice staff, incredibly helpful and speak English. Bathroom was a little subpar- water would get everywhere and the drains had a smell that just wouldn't go away- but nothing too bothersome. We stayed in two different rooms- one on the first floor and one on the third floor. If you can swing, it don't stay in the room on the first floor- pretty small. other room was much nicer. But both rooms were really small, not enough storage place- we basically just lived out of our suitcases. Also, the hotel next door has a rooftop party a couple times a week- till late at night so that may keep you up. Given the cost, we thought it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent Bosphorus view and staff attention”
Reviews.Author: giba_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, close to main atractions of Old Istanbul, Abdullah and his colleague at the reception helped a lot in suggesting places to visit and information on Turkey history, culture, etc. Although the room is simple, it is quiet and comfortable. Realy worthwhile compared to others in the area!!! Gilberto - from Brazil

Reviews.Title: “You are not going to find a better combination of features at any price.”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeTravels
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in two years that I have stayed at this hotel. The plesant and welcoming attitude of the owner, Hussein, is reflected by the entire staff. Here are some of the reasons I love staying here: Location: directly inbetween two of the world's great landmarks for breathtaking views whenever you go out into Istanbul. inspiring. also, close to the tram that you will use to get to all the landmarks and to/from the airport. safe neighborhood with almost too many dining options. the hotel is also located on a dead end street without any autos allowed so every room is quite (except for the call to prayers from the neighboring mosques). Room: the rooms are clean, spacious and nicely maintained. all the buildings in this part of town are aging but the staff does a good job of keeping the hotel fresh. i noticed a comment by another traveler who mentioned that a set of drawers would be helpful. i suspect that for a family that would be true but the free-standing closets in my rooms have had shelves which worked fine for me. Hospitality: as mentioned the staff is welcoming and accomodating. breakfast is served on the roof starting at 8:00 which works since sights don't open until 9:00 or later and you are close to all the major ones. how to get around town, what is worth going out of the way for, etc. are all topics the staff is up to date on. Downside: a few minor points to be aware of. there is wifi on all the floors but my system could not get service except at the lobby. there is good signal strength but my system just could not logon from my room. small niceties are sometimes missing, such, as a soap and shampoo holder in the shower. honestly, that is the only negatives i can think of and i am writing this from the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Oostkamp-travellers
Reviews.Content: It is a small quiet hotel near the Old Town. Only a few rooms and a rooftop terrace where you can breakfast with beautiful views of the Bosphorus and the Aya Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dops140
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hanedan hotel last weekend with our 14 month old son. The owner provided a baby cot and made room for the stroller downstairs. Even though our flight to istanbul had been delayed over three hours, the hotel pick up service was waiting for us at the airport. The hotel was very nice, the room was big and the bed was good. The location is also excellent for a short stay because so much is in walking distance. The breakfast with a view over the bosporus was a nice start to the day. The only downside I could find, and it is a little one, is that there was no closet space in the room. With a baby, it would have been nice to have a chest of drawers, to unpack clothes and use as a changing spot. But, in honesty, we haven't really missed it!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaGarcia10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend and it was really nice and clean. The staff is helpful and friendly and the location is very convenient. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it”
Reviews.Author: ShantiThisted
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotelâ€¦.the rooms, the breakfast, the staff, the clean rooms, the location, the price and the lovely roof terrasse, we will surely be back. Watch out if you get a taxi driver to the airport and have payed in advance. Once we left the hotel â€œwe were on our ownâ€�. The taxi driver stopped 5 minutes away and tried to squeeze us into another taxi with four more people and offered us a minimum of our money back, this seams to happen almost all the time. If this happens to you do not leave the taxi, but insist that the taxi you paid for takes you all the way to the airport. Karin and Dannie from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Great location, warm and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rabeaesq
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay on a budget, great location, amazing terrace available 24/7, unlimited hot water and clean towels. I felt very much at home.

Reviews.Title: “Wish this hotel was in every city!”
Reviews.Author: tracydavie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hanedan for 4 nights (6 people in 3 rooms) and thoroughly enjoyed it. The first thing I noticed when we arrived was the lovely smell of soap - the place is spotless! The man that cleans the rooms obviously takes great pride in his work. The front staff are also terrific, they are happy to help with any queries you have and give advice. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. The view of Aya Sofya and the Bosphorus from the roof terrace is superb. Only negative was the occasional sound of a slamming door but wasnt a big deal. This is the third hotel we have stayed in in this part of Istanbul and most definitely the best. At â‚¬40 a night it is also fantastic value. Will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value”
Reviews.Author: bseagram
Reviews.Content: Amazing location VERY near to St Sophia, near to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Cistern. Fabulous view of Bosphorus & Sea of Marmara & Golden Horn from hotel roof-top terrace, open 24 hrs). 1/2 block from Four Seasons Hotel. Istanbul even more sensational by night as it lights up beautifully. Staff at hotel very kind and always present to help. Recommend getting family room for extra space. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but excellent”
Reviews.Author: Birchy_10
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. Breakfast good. Rooms O.K. Roof terrace gives good views of the Bosphorous. Location excellent - restaurants nearby and all the sights within walking distance. A good place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and terrace view at a good price and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mgannaway
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the hotel. It is reasonably priced, modest and clean lodging. The location is perfect for walking to some of the most fabulous sites in the city and the tram. The staff was very friendly and Abdullah gave very good recomendations for local restaurants. I was very comfortable and felt safe staying there. The only thing that I would change is that the bed would be a little softer. I would stay there again because I liked the staff, the price, the location is central to so many historic sites (and not far from the Four Seasons Hotel and many restaurants), the hotel is clean, there was free wifi for my iPhone, there was plenty of hot water, and it is just off the main street so it was pretty quiet in the evening. The morning breakfasts were simple but delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, attentive staff and incredible view from the terrace.”
Reviews.Author: sarahgoodee
Reviews.Content: The people who work at the Hanedan were super friendly and attentive to all our requests. The location is perfect, on a charming street in Sultanahmet, and the terrace had an incredible view. The rooms on the upper floors are preferable to the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value combined with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: loukatNewYork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights in October. The rooms were nice and clean. Loved the rooftop terrace which had a hearty breakfast. Great views of the Sea of Marmara and Aya Sofya at a great price to stay there. The best part of staying there is it's proximity to the historic sites of Istanbul (the Blue Mosque & Ays Sofya) and the fantastic help that Abdullah provided us during our stay. He went out of his way to offer us great advice about restaurants, where to shop, and other insightful tips that made our stay in Istanbul one we will never forget. One of the best bargains in Istanbul. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well-located, gorgeous terrace”
Reviews.Author: charles_pittinger
Reviews.Content: Hanedan staff are helpful and friendly. The manager helps make your stay enjoyable. Located on a fun street with Turkish restaurants. Very close to the Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and the trams. Terrace overlooks the west mouth of the Bosphorus on one side, and the Sophia on the other. Great breakfast and happy hour viewing. Very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeeFace
Reviews.Content: Hanedan Hotel is perfectly lovely for a visit to Istanbul. We arrived on a Sunday and were put into the double room we booked. This is a small room and it is quite dark but it was very clean, had a small TV and would have done us perfectly for our entire stay. There is some noise from the breakfast terraces in the morning. However on the second night we got moved to the family room free of charge which was great, equally clean and well kept but lighter airier and to the front of the hotel so quieter as it is on a side street. Had we stayed in the original smaller and slightly noisier room for our whole 5 nights I may be saying to you try another hotel as there are plenty in this area, all family owned and some are slightly cheaper but I couldn't comment on them obviously and personally I can put up with those things if I know a place is in a good location and the staff are nice. The breakfast is perfectly fine, bread eggs meat cheese jams yoghurt olives.. typical Turkish style and the breakfast room and terrace has a lovely view over the Bosphorous and of the Aya Sofia. The staff are attentive polite and charming. The main thing this hotel has going for it though is it's location. A 10 min walk to all the major sites and 5 mins to the centre of Sultanahmet Square. Having walked around the other 'hotel areas' of Sultanahment, basically all the side streets off the main square in every direction, I think where we were was the nicest area, it had much less traffic than those on the other side of the Blue Mosque. The bar opposite is also really nice with cushions outside and lovely staff and reasonably priced beer for this close to the main sites at 6TL for a large Efes. If I had only one downside to this hotel it would be to say that they do lock their door at night.. I'm not entirely sure what time thsi was but we came home a few times at 1 or 2am after drinking over the road or in Beoglu and it was locked and we had to knock on the window to wake up the guy asleep on the couch in reception, he always seemed a little put out and I never worked out if this was ok or not! But that said, they never complained. A couple of random tips if you are travelling to Istanbul, get an akbil for 6TL and stick some money on it (the Istanbul equvalent of an Oyster Card) if you plan to leave the immediate area a lot... it's cheaper and easier than keep buying tokens and the metro and funicular are very good and very cheap at 1.50TL everywhere in the city. Boats are also cheap at between 2.50TL and 5TL out to the islands. Taxis are fine but since they became metered by law they often try to take you the long way to make extra money and the same journey three times cost me 6TL, 12 TL AND 15TL in the same week! Also change your money in Turkey (in Sutanahmet not the airport) you get a much better rate over there and there is a change office right in the main square. Istanbul is beautiful, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms are disappointing”
Reviews.Author: impossible50
Reviews.Content: Hanedan has a number of positives- great location in Sultanhamet, close to restaurants and sites, and good breakfasts. Unfortunately all of the double rooms face the back of the hotel. As a result they are rather dark and stuffy, and get a lot of noise from the adjacent hostel restaurant and bar. On our return after touring the rest of the country, we relocated to a smaller hotel over the street, which was a better option and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Terrace made a good deal a GREAT deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Totally satisfied - great location, helpful staff, quiet street in midst of a great neighborhood. Our triple was quite spacious by any standard and large for other hotels we stayed at in turkey. Terrace was incredible! If you want to try a turkish bath (and you should!) go with the place Hanedan recommends (name of it begins with "Ged....")... It was a way cool experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: MissingMillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely little quiet hotel in a triple room with our teenage son recently. The room was nicely decorated, the beds were comfortable, the views from the terrace were excellent (Aya Sofia & the Bosphorus), the buffet breakfast was good and the staff were very pleasant. We loved the fast, free wireless Internet connection for our notebook and iPhones. The location is perfect for walking to all of the historic sites in Sultanahmet, and close to the tram for exploring other parts of the city. This hotel represents great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way!!”
Reviews.Author: fabiatory
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I stayed in this hotel. Delicious breakfast and beautiful view from roof top terrace of sea and very close Aya Sophia. Location of hotel perfect for Istanbul's major sights, most within walking distance. (aunt is 75) Staff particularly friendly and helpful. Very clean and comfortable. Located next to street with numerous restaurants for exhausted travellers to chose from. Sept great time to go as not so hot. Be careful of taxi drivers. On 2 different occaisons they tried to say we'd given them 5 lira note and not the very similar 50 lira note we'd actually given them. First time we lost all our change. Only avoided giving them another big note by saying I'd call the Police. If you give big note say to them "Look 50 lira note!"

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jennycuthbertson1
Reviews.Content: great location fabulous roof top views over the Bosphorous the staff were very helpful, friendly and good fun

Reviews.Title: “Hanedan Hotel was Great!”
Reviews.Author: AF_NYC_10023
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hanedan Hotel twice in September. We had a great experience both times. The location was perfect (super-central) for seeing the sites in Sultanahmet. The rooms were nice, the view from the terrace was excellent, the breakfast was very good and the staff was accommodating. Both Zeki and Abdullah were helpful. -Aida

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mrmilk
Reviews.Content: hi everybody, i just got back from Turkey where i've been with my girlfriend for two weeks. We first stayed in Istanbul at this very nice hotel in the heart of the Sultanhamet area. I really enjoyed the place because it features clean rooms and a terrace where we had breakfast with a beautiful view on Aya Sophia and the Bosphorus. The room was kinda quiet during the night, being the hotel in a corner a little aside from the crowded main street. Plus, the guys working at reception, Abdullah and Zeki, are very nice and welcoming persons. So i'd like to suggest this place for a nice stay in Istanbul. Davide

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ehab8
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, friendly staff, convenient location, very clean. Overall we had a wonderful experience at the Hanedan Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendlyness with a capital F”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirl56
Reviews.Content: Hanedan Hotel was a wonderful place to stay in the magnificent city called Istanbul. Suleyman and staff could not have been more helpful or friendly to us while staying in their Hotel. We decided at the last minute to spend all our nights (11) in the hotel and Suleyman did everything he could to accommodate us which we will always appreciate. The breakfasts on the terrace are a treat and staff veryy welcoming every morning. Rooms always clean and with the Hotel in such a central position to all the main attractions you could not have asked for more. Thankyou Suleyman, we'll definately be back to stay if we travel to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “people at this hotel were all very kind !”
Reviews.Author: YukiKaise
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Istanbul for three days. At first, we tensed because this was the first trip to a foreign country for us. But it was an needless fear. People at this hotel were all very kind. We asked them freely if we have requests and questions. For example how to use a shower, where a change office was, or how much the taxi fare was. They answered such questions so politely and kindly with easy English. So we felt easy and relaxed, and we had a very good time in Istanbul. We appreciate the Hanedan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option in great location”
Reviews.Author: JS83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hanedan for 4 nights while in Istanbul. We wanted a budget-friendly option and this hotel was definitely one of the lower priced options at 60EUR a night. Rooms are small, but clean and charming with hardwood floors and 4-poster beds. Breakfast was traditional Turkish breakfast fare and had a decent spread of home-baked breads and pastries, fruits, cheese, olives, hard boiled eggs, jam, tea, coffee. The view on the rooftop terrace was amazing with views of the sea and the Aya Sofya. The location was also unbeatable, right in Sultanhamet and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Hanedan!!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_housewife
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my sister and two friends and we stayed in the "family room" at the Hanedan Hotel. The staff and owner are very friendly, the rooms are basic, but really clean. I loved the breakfast on the terrace, complete with a view of Istanbul, every morning! The location is great too, you are within walking distance of most tourist sights and a short/inexpensive cab ride to the "far away" ones. I would love to go back there someday!! Oh, another plus, they had a laptop and wireless internet in the main room, which allowed me to email my kids every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Finnarn
Reviews.Content: We stayed with three children in the double family room on the top named "Byzantine". The rooms are not big, but clean and nice. Given the exciting location there are no reasons for spending to much time in the room either. The roof terrace where breakfast was served was a great, nice views in all directions.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: sfjtjb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice while we were on a 3-week vacation in Turkey. We stayed here for our first two nights in Turkey -- and our last night (by chance). Our first room was on the second floor, had a window that looked out on a tree trunk and drying laundry and was noisy in the morning with people talking below (staff maybe?). The breakfast is great, however, compared with some we had. Why is it great? Real coffee and they offer yogurt -- in addition to all the standard cheese, jams, bread, etc. Our second stay was better: we were put in the Byzantine room which was MUCH bigger than our first room and had windows on two sides of the room that looked out on the Bosphorus. Other than that, it's just a hotel but the prices are reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, friendly, quiet hotel in a prime tourist spot”
Reviews.Author: SFgal94110
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Sultanahmet, the old part of European Istanbul, the Hanedan is a great choice. It's in the middle of things but quiet, because it's off the crazy main tourist street. The rooftop terrace is a delightful oasis with a gorgeous view of the Hagia Sofia and the Bosphorous. Breakfast is delicious and bountiful. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rates for our triple room were quite good, and we had all the amenities we needed. A very good European style basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family room”
Reviews.Author: Pasqualino
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the third floor (walk-up) family room with our two sons. It was really two separate rooms - one with a double bed and the other with 2 twins. They were small, had to sit on the bed, but adequate. It had a lovely view of the Sea of Maramara. Honestly, we spent very little time the room. We were out sightseeing all day. ...Breakfast was served on the roof top terrace with a spectacular view of the Hagia Sophia. We liked the yogurt, bread and fresh fruit . The juice needs improvement, but maybe we were spoiled with all the fresh squeezed orange juice we drank around town. The staff was very nice. They responded quickly to all emails and arranged airport pick-up and drop-off. About a week before our trip, when the Hamdi restaurant did not respond to two email reservation requests, I asked the hotel to call. We got a table on the 3rd floor terrace at sunset - spectacular - the food was good too. ..We were able to use the laptop computer in the lobby to check email. My sons enjoyed watching the World Cup on the lobby TV with the staff...Overall, the Hanedan was clean, in a perfect location, and a very reasonable price especially for a family!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mittensam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hanedan Hotel in July with our two sons (8 and 12). The hotel is truly lovely. We had a family room with a sea view. The view is beautiful and the room was great. The staff at the hotel are extremely helpful and knowledgeable about Istanbul. We have stayed in many hotels and we would as fantastic! Breakfast was delicious and the view was breathtaking. In fact, we had drinks at the four seasons one night and the view at the Hanedan was as good!

Reviews.Title: “The best part of Istanbul--Hanedan Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hhgould
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a crazy, busy, bustling city filled with all types of people. Hanedan Hotel offers a quiet, comfortable, relaxing safe haven in the midst of the big city. The staff is knowledgable and friendly--Ruhat, especially, can tell you everything you want to know about the city. To get the most out of your trip to Istabul, stay at Hanedan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and value”
Reviews.Author: GK79
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest features of Hanedan (and there are a few) is the friendliness of the staff, and their willingness to accommodate guests. To give an example, I arrived in the neighborhood with a friend looking for a rooftop terrace to admire the Aiya Sofya lit up at night. Unfortunately, rooftop terraces had just closed. I returned to Hanedan to see if they knew of any still open; since there were none, they let me use theirs. The location is great, and the value is top notch. I had moved from a conference hotel near Taksim that couldn't compare with the service, location or price of Hanedan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: deirdrab
Reviews.Content: Our experience in this hotel was great. We stayed at this hotel for 8 days while we were in Istanbul. The location is great. Itâ€™s minutes away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and 5- 10 minutes from the tram. The view from the terrace faces the water; there is breakfast on the terrace every morning. The hotel staff was especially amazing; they were friendly, always helpful calling in reservations, chatty. As some other reviewers noted this is not a 5 star hotel (which is fine for us), but for the price, location, friendly staff and view, the accommodations are more than acceptable. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely go back: clean rooms, great service, great views”
Reviews.Author: nomadita
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the room named "ottoman" and it was a bright and cheerful yellow room with lots of light. it was very clean and good value for the offering. the staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was excellent. I especially enjoyed the amazing view from the roof terrace of the south side of aya sofya, as well as the sea. the only downside is that there is no internet. I will plan to stay there the next time I am in Istanbul. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great location!”
Reviews.Author: mjscott1969
Reviews.Content: The Hanedan was a wonderful find! Sometimes you don't know what to expect when you find a place online...but we were pleasantly surprised! The location in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul is perfect...steps away from wonderful restaurants and a 10 minute walk to many of the major tourist attractions - the beautiful Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace and so much more! The views from the Hanedan are incredible!! From the rooftop terrace, you can see the Bosphorous Strait, the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya! We had happy hour on our terrace each day! It was fun to watch all the ships come in and out on the Bosphorous! You do hear the call to prayer from all the mosques...I loved it! But it is loud at 4 in the morning!! I was there 5 nights and I think it only woke me up once! The staff at the Hanedan were wonderful...helping us with taxi rides to and from the airport, giving us directions to restaurants and having great conversations!! Thanks Suleyman - you have a wonderful place and we hope to be back someday!!

Reviews.Title: “Hanedan forgott the reservation - SHOCK”
Reviews.Author: bgpower
Reviews.Content: We planned from February 2010 a trip to istanbul, because of the Formula 1 race in the End of May. We booked with a credit card a family room in the Hanedan Hotel and were very happy, because of the favourable price and the great location. Everything was "confirmed" by the Hotel-staff via E-mail again at the beginning of May, when we exchanged some e-mail regarding a possible hotel shuttle bus to the race circuit. As we were there, there turned out to be NO RESERVATION for our room and the hotel was already full. Though we checked our e-mail correspondence, they have come up with the excuse that in February a staff-member made many reservation errors and he was already fired. Good, but we had exchanged some e-mails in May???? and were already in Istanbul. The hotel staff was helpful (as it had to be) and found through a friend (in Turkish "abi") 2 hotel rooms for us in the Sultansaray Hotel. Good, we had to pay 20 Euros more, but this was acceptable. The guy helped us reach the new hotel and after 3-4 hours lost sightseing time, we had a solution of our problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service = A+++”
Reviews.Author: drulee
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Hanedan. What we liked: * The location is amazing - about a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, and Topkapi. Can't be beat. * Great nearby restaurants. Love Albura and Rumist which is next door * Service was super friendly. Not overly bubbly and in your face, but nice/solid/reliable friendliness. Particularly Abdullah, Suleyman, and Rohit - all very nice gentlemen who not only were helpful with their tips, but seemed to go out of the way to make our stay pleasurable. Adbullah actually walked me to a train station and also a Hamam to ensure I didn't get lost. Nice guy. Suleyman was just so fun to chat with, since he and I were both fathers of little ones so we enjoyed sharing stories. They let us keep our stroller downstairs and helped us carry things, including food, up the 3 flights up to our room * Breakfast on the roof patio - beatitful views and the food was good. I'm not going to say it was great, but cmon ppl what do you expect? You're not staying at a 5*. They had a great spread of cold cuts, cheeses, fruits...and the home made bread is fantastic. The cute girl working there was very friendly as well. * Room - we had the large family room which had a sea view. AMAZING view of the sea at night with the moon floating above the horizon. Very romantic Overall we very much enjoyed our stay. I would recommend it. I miss Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chaden
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i have stayed in, in Istanbul, i have been many times. The location was in a terrific area close to all we wished to visit. The hotel itself was very clean and i can not think of one fault that i would wish to comment on, there just was not any to speak about. The staff were polite and mannerly at all times, the night receptionist always asked how our evening had went and seemed interested in where we had been. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends, As i have stated it really is the best i have stayed in, and i will return there on my next visit to this wonderful city. My friend and i felt so at home and comfortable, the break was a wonderful time for us.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe you can find something better then this..”
Reviews.Author: alexoiu
Reviews.Content: I went with some friends in Istanbul about a month ago. I stayed at Hanedan Hotel and i wasn't very happy with my choice: poor breakfast, problems with the hot water, a huge whole in our floor along with some other ones. Also, in one night we sat at the entrance of the hotel for about 30-40 minutes ringing and knocking at the door until the guy from the reception woke up from sleep. This is a cheap hotel, you cannot ask to much from this kind of hotel, but i will not make the mistake to come back there. Istanbul is awesome - planning to be back there soon !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful help during the volcano crisis”
Reviews.Author: Devonciderboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids aged 12 and 10 twice. Once before the volcano and then for 5 nights after our flight was cancelled. This is a great, good value hotel for a family like ours. It is walking distance from major sights, clean and comfortable with several family rooms for 4 (rare in Istanbul). The roof terrace is lovely and breakfasts good. What made it special for us was the help Suleyman and his folks gave us when we were stuck. They were great and it made a difficult time much easier. The only drwaback is the noise from local bars. We were there for a few days before ANZAC day so maybe that may explain it. This whole set of streets contains many hotels that range from the luxurious 4 Seasons to lost of nice family-run hotels to backpacker hostels all next to each other. This is unfortunate. I have nothing against lively ypoung bars and we liked to visit them, but at night they keep the music on very late and very loud - even if they are empty. This made it very hard to sleep without ear plugs. This is not really the hotel owners fault but I would urge them all to work together to get say a midnight curfew out of consideration to ALL the people who share this lively and pleasant location to say. Overall, a great place to stay but bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and homelike.”
Reviews.Author: kittens2
Reviews.Content: I had emailed several "bed and breakfast" type hotels in Istanbul prior to my visit. The Hanedan Hotel was the first to respond, so I booked with them. They are in the excellent Sultanahmet district location, within easy walking distance to many major sites. My room was freshly decorated and maintained spotlessly. The price I found extremely accomodating to my budget. The staff was kind, helpful and very friendly. They made me feel like family. The atmosphere was relaxed and home like, which I appreciated as a solo traveler. Each morning I ate a delicious included Turkish breakfast on the hotel top level which overlooked the Maramara Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Coldly convinient”
Reviews.Author: tieredTraveller
Reviews.Content: Clean and convenient. Close to most places to visit. Has good views from the top of the hotel of the sea and the Hagi Sophie. Good and healthy breakfast, though the same on all days we stayed there. However the rooms were unusually cold and no running hot water. Staff showed reluctance to fix both the problems. Had to usually cal up a few times to ask them to start the room heater. They were never really able to fix the hot water (or lack of it) problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hanedan Hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: smpigeon
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay in Istanbul at Hanedan Hotel. It was great. The front desk/reception were very friendly and accommodating, breakfast was included with room, and the cleaning staff was also very attentive and asked every day if I needed new towels or anything else. It was a perfect location, about a 3 minute walk to Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque and had a nice view of Hagia Sofia and the Marmar Sea from the upstairs terrace. I would definitely recommend to stay here and I plan on returning in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “No need to look any further”
Reviews.Author: tmoon1111
Reviews.Content: For only 25 euro a night, this hotel offered me everything I was looking for. Safe, clean, friendly and conveniently located, a great included breakfast, a hairdryer....there was nothing left to be desired. If I return to Istanbul I will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: RelativeWay
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. They have a lovely rooftop terrace with good views of the Bosphorus and nice views of Agia Sophia. The room was very clean and the service was great. They had no problems with an early check in and even offered us breakfast! We would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably price option in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: London_Toffeeman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hanedan for 6 nights in mid November and were fairly happy with our stay. Our room Commagene was fairly small but clean and fairly comfortable. My biggest criticism would be the noise. The first night was extremely quiet except for the sound of the local muezzin the following morning. However our sleep was interrupted the following night by what sounded like an air conditioning unit from an adjacent building, which produced an extremely annoying irregular clicking noise. Whilst we always like to sleep with the window open, this simply was not possible and we switched on the air conditioning unit in the room which was also very loud, but slightly the lesser of 2 evils. The third night (Saturday) brought with it some loud music from the bar behind the hotel, which was playing some very cheesy dance music at a loud volume. But the loud clicking noise continued and actually drowned out the dance music. By night four, we had purchased ear plugs. So sods law dictated that the air conditioning noise and the dance music had stopped. So all was as peaceful as the first night. We even slept through to the call to prayer. Nights 5 and 6 were also quiet. In defence of the hotel staff, I don't think there was anything they could have done, as the noise was coming from other buildings. So we didn't complain. However, I would advise taking ear plugs just in case. A room on the street side should also be quieter. Apart from the noise and the size of the room, we found the accommodation to be fairly good value for money. The bed is a four poster, the room has adequate lighting, and although noisy, the air conditioning can soon cool the room. There is also a safe. The bathroom was clean. Water pressure and temperature in the shower was variable. But I suspect this would be a problem in all Istanbul properties. The hotel is located on a busy street, packed with restaurants and bars. So you're right in the middle of the action in Sultanahmet with the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya around 5 minutes walk away. We took the offer of the car from the airport (EUR 15), to make our arrival as simple as possible, and the owner converts this back to Turkish Lira using a published internet conversion rate (www.xe.com). However, once you get used to public transportation, you'll find it fairly easy and much cheaper to navigate your own way back to the airport. Service at the hotel was fairly good, with the reception staff always welcoming and chatty, the cleaning staff friendly and the breakfast staff also helpful. Breakfast on the roof of the hotel (indoors in summer) is a fairly simple continental affair, but does the job. The bread is lovely and fresh and there is a good selection of meats, cheeses, olives, jam and fruit. I particularly enjoyed the yogurt which you can put fruit on top. Overall, I would recommend Hanedan as a good cheap option in a great location close to all the main attractions. So it's an ideal base for a short trip to Istanbul. If you're not expecting top class luxury, you'll be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: kimmieluwho
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've had in Turkey. I'm an expat and have travelled around the country a fair bit. Hanedan came recommended by other expats in Turkey and it did not disappoint. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean, tidy, and pleasingly decorated, and the breakfast was wonderful. I plan to stay at Hanedan again and to recommend it to anyone I know going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly handled checkout overshadows pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2002
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in 2 rooms at the Hanedan this fall. We'd first like to echo many of the comments of previous reviews. That it is a hotel with a great location close to many attractions, it was clean, a good breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace, and the pickup service from the airport was excellent. One item needing improvement is towels. They were a bit frayed at the edges. We had an enjoyable stay until it came time to checkout. At checkout the bill was higher than it should have been. When we questioned our bill, we were told the triple room that we had reserved had not been available. Instead we were given a larger room so we were charged more. We felt this was wrong and that we should not have to pay the extra amount due to their mistake. It was apparent that management did not want to refund the charges & instead continued to give reasons hoping that we'd agree. Eventually after at least 10 min. of discussion (which at the time seemed much longer), we were refunded the difference. If the hotel had known of a room problem ahead of time, they could have emailed us. Then we could made the decision to stay or to find new lodging. As a traveler, I want to be able to plan and budget my expenses on our trips.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the place”
Reviews.Author: LancasterLad
Reviews.Content: For the price the Hanedan is great value. We booked 3 months ago at the off-peak price of 40 Euros for a double with breakfast. We were surprised and delighted to be given a family room (Ottoman Room). The room was always spotlessly cleaned, fresh towels daily, constant hot water The bed was comfy. The shower fine. Breakfast is traditional and plentiful, and filling enough to ensure lunch wil only be a snack. The views from the terrace are gorgeous. The area is quiet and perfectly safe. 5 mintues or so easy walk from the major sights. The staff are young, friendly and very helpful. The only downpoint is for people with mobility problems, but to be honest that's Istanbul anyway. Would we stay there again? Definately, but there also looked to be many other delightful hotels and B&Bs all over the place. Top-tips: Take a travel kettle, and a universal plug for the bathroom wash basin.

Reviews.Title: “One could hardly do better than Hanedan”
Reviews.Author: boscosq
Reviews.Content: We just spent a very satisfying 'off-season' week there. Great location in terms of accessing the old city sights. Excellent staff: friendly, courteous, helpful. Satisfying range of options in the full-breakfast (inclusive). We liked the traditional decor, 4-post bed, squeaky wooden floors and quite comfy bed. An all-around outstanding value for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfasting at eye-level with the Aya Sofia”
Reviews.Author: backgammonfiend
Reviews.Content: We chose Hanedan based on TripAdvisor reviews and weren't disappointed. Very handily located for all the Sultanahmet sights, and just off a touristy but pleasant road of bars and restaurants. We made use of the airport pickup (be aware that there is a charge for this, payable on checkout - not cheap, but a hassle free way to arrive). The room was very clean and nicely appointed. no view to speak of but the vista from the breakfast terrace more than make up for that, with the meal itself a decent self-service buffet. You can use the terrace during the day, some welcome respite from the busy streets and much nicer than staying cooped up in a room. Staff were never anything but friendly and helpful, assisting us with our onward accommodation arrangements and early morning taxis. We really enjoyed staying here. You can hear the calls to prayer, but that's true of practically every hotel in the area I'd imagine. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch experience for 12 days and 13 nights!”
Reviews.Author: JimandMitch
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were greeted warmly and efficiently following hotel pickup at Ataturk. When we saw our room, we were very pleased. The Hanedan is in an excellent location, expanded upon by many other reviews in TripAdvisor. The staff are helpful, interested, and interesting. It's clean and breakfast on the terrace is a beautiful experience in taste and view. The price is an incredibly good value. Excellent wireless net. The bed is deceptively comfortable. Among the many amenities in the neighborhood is a fine hand laundry and dry cleaner just around the corner. Also an abundance of very cool, seemingly contented cats hanging around. We would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: LeilaA
Reviews.Content: I would have given this spot 5 stars, but it was just a bit too noisy. I was woken up each night from the 5am prayer call. Other than that, I loved the place. It was clean, in a great location, and the room was spacious. The breakfast was also great, and featured a fabulous view! I couldn't believe that a place this good could be so cheap!

Reviews.Title: “a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: silvia1967
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real, wonderful gem! The location is great: super-central but at the same time slightly off the main sultanhamet crowd. I particularly appreciate this as a solo woman, so I can relax a bit even in the evening in the street just outside the hotel. The staff is extra-kind, they do all their best to accomodate all your needs and they speak excellent english. The rooms are possibly the highest hotel point, with lots of character, canopy beds (!) and spotless cleaness. I already went back to this hotel twice so far and is like to go back home, not in a "cold" hotel room. I would definitely recommend it: I went back since a couple of weeks and I already miss it and looking forward to go back to the hanedan soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Well-located, Great Rooftop Deck”
Reviews.Author: Moth612
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week recently by myself on my first trip to Istanbul. I was a little worried about what it might be like to travel as a woman alone so I purposely chose a smaller hotel. The Hanedan Hotel felt perfectly safe, although I was surprised to find it run by young people and not the multi-generational family I imagined. The hotel is located just underneath the Aya Sofia (about two blocks down a very steep hill towards the water). It is just off of a main tourist street, filled with tourist-friendly restaurants and shops, travel agencies for day trips, small grocery shops, etc. An ATM is located about 1.5 blocks away, as is a post office. The cooking school is on this street as well. The Four Seasons is right there too. It feels safe in the immediate neighborhood, although definitely touristy (but interestingly, the tourists were a very international mix, running the gamut from backpackers to families to high-end denizens of the Four Seasons.) Some of the shopkeepers are quite aggressive (in a mostly friendly but very persistent way). But for a first-time tourist, the neighborhood around this hotel was pretty great. The hotel itself has 3 floors of rooms, with a very steep and somewhat narrow staircase (thank goodness the desk clerk offered to take my luggage up to my 3rd floor room!). There are only a few rooms on each floor, and while I could hear the doors being opened and closed, this was definitely a quiet hotel guest-wise. The rooftop breakfast room/deck was amazing, with perfect views of the Bosphorus, the Marmara Sea, and over the shoulder, a lovely view of the Aya Sofia. To see the Blue Mosque (only about 4 blocks away) you have to crane your neck, but you can see all 6 minarets. My room was VERY clean, with marble tile in the bathroom and a refinished dark wood floor in the small entry hall and bedroom. Each room is named after a different historic period in Turkey, and while my room didn't have a good view (I saw into the building next door), the room was large enough for my queen size 4-poster bed, plus a desk and chair and plenty of room for yoga on the floor. Oddly, there were obviously supposed to be two traditional paintings on the wall, but one was missing. There was just the nail and some marks in the paint where it had been. It felt pretty discordant with the rest of my experience, but it also suggested a more casual and relaxed atmosphere (which fortunately did not extend to cleanliness, which was excellent!). There is free wireless internet (with a server on each floor so there is plenty of bandwidth and it was never slow while I was there). There was no TV in the room, but that was fine with me since I hadn't come to watch TV. The AC worked quickly and well. The shower had plenty of water pressure (and plenty of hot water). The desk, as I mentioned before, was run by younger men who all seemed friendly, although not all of them spoke English all that well (they just ran across the street to a sister hotel if there was a language issue and things got worked out quickly). They were all very friendly and polite. The breakfast was pretty good, BTW. There was fresh bread, thick Turkish yogurt, a selection of jams, honey, and butter, as well as olive spread and two different kinds of cheese and cold cuts. There were also hard-boiled eggs. There were fresh apricots every morning, and some mornings there were grapes or melon. The friendly young woman working there was quick to make tea or coffee to order. The view for breakfast was really amazing, and it added up to quite a pleasant experience. Overall, I found the hotel to be quiet and relaxed. It was not really fancy, and besides the lobby and the rooftop deck, there weren't public spaces. It was great to have the internet access, and it was great that everything was clean. Nothing was really fancy (for example, I could see on the next rooftop deck over, there were hammocks that people could use, and several other rooftop decks on neighboring hotels had bars and restaurants), but it was a good solid place to stay. And probably the lack of flashy tourist draws made this hotel a lot quieter, so it really works for people looking for a basic decent place that is near to the action but is pretty quiet and safe inside. I'd certainly stay there next time I go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for value, great location”
Reviews.Author: irmalaboule
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hanedan hotel for 7 nights with our 2 little girls. They have 3 family rooms and we stayed in all of them. Our room on the 1st floor had a problem with air conditioning, so we've been moved to the second floor and,as we came back after 4 days away, they offered us the room with sea view as a gesture for the airco problem.
