They are all spacious and clean. On the 3rd floor, the view is amazing and there, you have actually a separate room for the children, while in the other 2, we all sleep in the same room. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only minus point was that the sheets could have been better quality... But all in one, we were happy!

Reviews.Title: “nice oldish rooms and wondrous sight from the terrace”
Reviews.Author: Armado
Reviews.Content: Quite, nice, oldish, with a flair of Ottoman civilization. Comfortable rooms. Hot water at leisure. And I'll never forget the breathtaking view when I went up to the terrace for breakfast: Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmet - for Euros and Anericans"the Blue Mosque", and the Marmara Sea, and the old city Walls. A very nice place to stay, , just what one needs to enjoy in total relaxation the incomparable beauty of Istanbul. The manager, Suleyman Karakus, is a bright young person with whom one can have very interesting conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: nuriaBilbao
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in one of the most touristic areas in Istanbul. Having breakfast with a view of the Aya Sofya and the Marmara is just wonderful. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our third visit to Hanedan in Five Months”
Reviews.Author: Alice+Angus
Reviews.Content: We are back again at the Hanedan Hotel. Perfect location and fair price. Our plane was four hours late from Malta due to turning back with serious generator problem. The driver sent by the Hanedan to meet our flight said "Four hours NO problem, eight hours, a problem!" We couldn't believe he was there waiting for us. Suleyman greeted me with a hug. All the staff are very friendly and lean over backwards to be helpful. We were so glad to be back in familiar territory. We love the Turkish breakfast on the roof and overlooking the Marmara Sea. There are good restaurants down the street. Rooms are small, beds are comfortable, all is clean, AC is nice this time of year and wifi is convenient. We will be back to the Hanedan again to enjoy this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: elliemeg
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel be in a fairly good location , but it can be quite noisey til about midnight as its surrounded by other bars, restaurants hotels etc. rooms were fine, basic but clean and we had a nice view of the sea but quite a long way up 3 flights of stairs. we found the cleaning man to be the friendliest person there, always smiling. hotel is quite near the four seasons hotel so about 6-8 mins walk from the blue mosque and hagia sofia, which was great breakfast was fairly basic but ok, the usual turkish breakfast, the only thing missing was some cereal or normal tea. it was help yourself buffet and the bread was fresh most days, so it was adequate, but the young girl looking after the breakfast wasnt very helpful or friendly we found the management ok, not overly friendly but not rude either, infact apart from saying hello and bye they didnt really speak to us , i have a feeling this was because we had been to istanbul before and were doing our own thing. we were celebrating our anniversary which they were aware of and despite my mother in law asking if they could put flowers or something in our room as a nice gesture they refused which i thought was a bit mean. we go to turkey up to 6 times a year and usually find the turkish people extra friendly and obliging but we didnt in this case we had a good stay and for the price it was ok, the hotel was small, clean and in a good location, it has stunning views from the terrace of the bosphorus , hagia sofia and blue mosque

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel right in the heart of Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: jackbrat
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed at the Hanedan for 2 nights in the Family Room with the sea view in mid-May. It is ideally situated in a neighbourhood consisting mostly of hotels, bars and restaurants and is a 5 minute walk to the major sites in the old city. The rooms and bathroom are basic and in need of a little paint but still are clean and comfortable. Breakfast on the terrance is definately worth the stay as the view is amazing and food selection is better compared to some other Turkish hotels we stayed at. The entire staff were very friendly and accommodating to any of our requests. For those coffee lovers who need their hit of caffiene before the hotel breakfast starts, try popping into the cafe next door. The owner was nice enough to whip up some Cafe Americanos for us at 7 am. I would definitely return to the Hanedan next time I'm in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family holidays”
Reviews.Author: hhhhhhhh_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our daughter (2 years) in a large, cozy family room that is big enough to play and stay during the day. The staff is extremely nice to children and made its best to make our stay comfortable and respond our special needs (like for example warm milk at breakfast). A very likeable place!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location AND Service”
Reviews.Author: Foreveryounger
Reviews.Content: Turn your gaze to the left from the roof and Hagia Sophia is almost your neighbor. Look to the right and one hundred ships are moving in every direction. You can't imagine a better view for breakfast. Starbucks is 10 min. and Blue Mosque is 5 min. The friendly staff will arrange it all for you: taxies, ordering out, reservations, you name it. Warm, humorous, helpful. Rooms are modest but fine. You can borrow the wine opener I left at the front desk. A+

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for reasonable accomodation in a stanbul”
Reviews.Author: travelchick05
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently stayed at the Hanedan for 7 nights. The location was great and the room and breakfast were just fine. If you want a reasonably priced place to stay in a excellent location, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor48
Reviews.Content: Centrally located but in quiet street. Friendly helpful staff. Lovely varied breakfast available till 11 am. Four poster beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: madridchiro
Reviews.Content: I booked a family room for 4 of us with extra bed so we don't have to share bed(mother in law) and it was perfect. Staff is excellent and friendly. The lady at the breakfast went out of her way to make sure we had all that we wanted, thank you! The location is great and the price is unbeatable. I stayed at their sister hotel, Peninsula Jan. 09. and both are great. Thank you Hosseine, You were so helpful. Thank you, Ondar for getting us to the airport on time once more.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: perrygirl
Reviews.Content: You will not find a better place to stay in Istanbul. We just returned yesterday and can say that the location is absolutely the best and for the price of the accommodation you will not find better. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. Breakfast good, albeit the same every day but you really can't complain with the views of Haigha Sophia at your back and the Bosphorous at the front. Our friends stayed at the Best Western and said the next time they come to Istanbul they would much rather stay at Hanedan.

Reviews.Title: “a great value hotel for families & few minutes walk from Sultanamet Square”
Reviews.Author: freelife3
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights in a two bedrooms suite, one double bedroom and one two single bedroom, ideal for a family. The view over the Bosphore was stunning and the trustworthy staff truly friendly and efficient. Perhaps the mold in the bathroom' ceiling would have put off many guests but on balance I highly recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great; staff is even better: friendly, helpful, fun. We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: sulilovesroxy
Reviews.Content: You may find a fancier hotel in Istanbul, but you won't find a nicer, friendlier, or more helpful staff. Unlike the writer above, we found every recommendation to be first-rate, from the hamam to various restaurants, including the "Fifth Floor" - a true find. The rooms are clean and comfortable; the location is the best in the city; the whole experience is five star. We're already planning a return trip in June. Thanks, Hanedan folks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: StudyTripOrganiser
Reviews.Content: We took a group (all ages) to stay at Hanedan Hotel and its sister Hotel Peninsula (opposite in same street). We found them both excellent value: very conveniently sited, quiet and clean, terrific Turkish buffet breakfast (the yogurt is to die for), and with the friendliest management you could hope for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: alquo
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to all sights and transport. Quiet place - double glazed windows. Variable shower heat. Great breakfast. Clean. No lifts 3-4 storeys high. Protruding bed springs could be replaced. Poor internet wireless connection - sit down stairs instead. Avoid recommended restaurants eg. Malkoc restaurant nearby - run by relatives/friends? (service charges, misrepresentation of menu and mistakes in bill in their favour). Best restaurant is Terkirdag Restaurant price and taste wise - found this on our last day!! Watch the sharp management - we booked transport to and from the airport 4 times for 5 people, the first 3 was in an adequate vehicle but on the last trip we were put into a small Fiat Doblo ( 6 people incld. driver - the manager's Kurdish relative). No apology or discount. We had no choice as it was our last morning in Istanbul. Suspect it was payback for telling fellow tourist not to go to the Malkoc or an opportunity to make some money on our last day. Also avoid the Hotel recommended Bosphorus tour - does not go all the way to the Black sea and the guide was uninterested and had very poor command of English - could not understand him.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Sultan790
Reviews.Content: Hanedan is perfectly located in the Sultanamet disctrict which allows you to walk to various historic sites within minutes. The hotel is more like a bed and breakfast style of establishment where it's an older home that's been transformed into hotel. It's a very informal atmosphere (in a good way) as the owners will take good care of you and ensure your stay is a good one. I would recommend buying tours from them directly. The rooms are quite small with limited amenities (no tv, iron, etc) but the washroom was fine. However, the hot water was eratic and had a mind of its own as it took us about 20 minutes to get it warm and then it got too hot and then back to cold. Breakfast is located on the roof and it's just coffee, some fruit and hard boiled eggs - it's edibile but we skipped out after 2 days for other nearby restaurants. At the end of the day, if you are looking for a great location, great deal and a place to just to sleep/store your belongings - this is the best place in Istanbul and I would highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally good”
Reviews.Author: AuldReekieAtko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hanedan Hotel in November 2008 and I was very impressed overall. The hotel has a near perfect location in Sultanahmet, the best area in Istanbul to stay. I stayed in a single room which would have easily sufficed as a double. The bed was big and comfortable, the room design was typically Ottoman and the ensuite shower/bathroom was clean and relatively spacious. The area is also pretty quiet, which meant minimum fuss in getting a good night's sleep. The owner and his friends that help out were fantastic - exceptionally friendly people with lots of advice and they would bend over backwards to help out, whether it is organising transport to and from Ataturk airport or advising where best to have a Turkish shave. Considering that the price of a room in this hotel is more budget than luxury, it represents great value for money. I would definitely return to the Hanedan on my next visit to Istanbul and would advise most travellers to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Arguably the best that a boutique hotel has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: redpaperbowl
Reviews.Content: Hanedan Hotel is undeniably one of the best boutique hotels I have stayed in. My friend and I booked for 5 days and we stayed in the Ottoman suite. The room was s-p-a-c-i-o-u-s, service impeccable, cleanliness assured and best of all, it's right in the heart of Sultanahmet where you get a fantastic view of the Marmara Sea while enjoying home made breakfast on the roof terrace! Totally worth the (reasonable) price. In the vicinity, restaurants, tour agencies and convenience stores dot the cobbled road leading to Hanedan. The hotel is also within 5 minutes walking distance to the tramway and about 15 minutes to the Grand Bazaar. Despite all the hustle and bustle about the Sultanahmet area, Hanedan is sheltered in a nice quiet cul de sac away from the noisy party revellers and traffic congestion. We were glad we picked Hanedan and would definitely recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginaxoxo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was soo great. The staff was warm and so friendly. The bed was comfortable, everything was so clean. Breakfast on the terrace was beautiful and the food was really good. This was the my first time coming to Istanbul, Turkey and I must say staying here made my experience that much more wonderful. I am definitely planning to come back. I highly recommend this hotel. The location was a perfect walking distance to all the sights. I will never forget my experience..

Reviews.Title: “wish its my second home.”
Reviews.Author: Honest_malaysian
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to write when so many people have already written so much. You really have to experience it to fully understand why they said it. I made my reservation through the internet and has been communicating with the manager Suleyman quite constantly, including arranging pick-up transport from the airport. Everything goes smoothly. Check in time is at 11am and when i arrived at 8, i was invited to have breakfast on the roof terrace (with spectacular scenery). To kill time, just walk and visit the Topkapi palace (that would easily kill 2 hours of yr time), Arya Sofia and the Blue Mosque - so you kill two birds with a single stone (part of yr tourism plan done while waiting for check-in). These 3 main tourist sites are within walking distance (not even 5 minutes). Hanedan is perfectly located, quiet, beautiful, with abundant restaurants, shops and other budget hotels around. This area is the old part of Istanbul and thus appear so much exotic and full of characters. U can actually see the historic wall behind some of the houses here. The room is clean, beautiful and comfortable - albeit a bit small (not a problem for me). While i was doing my tour around Turkey (away from Istanbul), i just leave one of my luggage in the hotel store room (with permission of course) and thus travel with a much lighter backpacking. This is one major good thing i like abt this hotel - which unfortunately, i didnt know earlier. If i knew before i came, i would have brought a bigger bag to accommodate more souvenirs. The breakfast is healthy and nice and with the view, anything would taste better. The staff are all very helpful and friendly. It make me feel very much at home and am pretty sad when its time to go home. So, if i ever go to Turkey again, i know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect locatÄ±on, great hospÄ±talÄ±ty at Hanedan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen1234V
Reviews.Content: We have just had a great experience at Hanedan Hotel! The rooms -- even the standard rooms -- are lovely, the location can't be beat, and the staff are so warm, friendly, and willing to give advice. We would highly recommend a stay at Hanedan. From the hotel it is only a short walk to Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Metro, and Topkapi Palace. Thank you, Suleyman, for a very nice stay! We hope to be back someday...

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay in Hanedan”
Reviews.Author: Katerinavv
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 wonderful nights in Hanedan in the beginning of November, 2008. After a smooth transfer from the airport to the hotel arranged by Suleyman we were pleasantly surprised by the offer to occupy a room with a sea view. The room was not large, but very clean and tidy, there was always supply of hot water, even late at night. The room was cleaned and the towels were changed every day. We liked very much breakfasts on a sunny terrace, which were served from 8 to 11 a.m. and included boiled eggs, fresh bread, fruits, yogurt, cheese, jams and pastry. The view from the terrace was really breathtaking - the Sea of Marmara on the one side and Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque on the other. It was very romantic to sit on the terrace at night with a glass of wine observing chaotic movement of small and big ships on the sea surface, the beautifully illuminated Aya Sofya and the general view of Istanbul. Another pleasant thing about Hanedan is a possibility to connect to the Internet through free wi-fi, so we could use our laptop to check e-mails, chat with friends, etc. Suleyman and all hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, always answering our questions how to get to the places which we wanted to visit. The hotel has a perfect location, just 5 minutes walk to Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace. The side-street where Hanedan is located is very quet and cosy. We never were disturbed by any noise. Around the hotel there are a lot of cafes and restaurants. The tram station located nearby is another advantage. The city tram makes it easy to get fast to Eminonu, Karakoy, Kabatas, Grand Bazaar, and other city districts. When we go to Istanbul next time we will surely book a room in Hanedan again, because the place is ideal for romantic holidays in Istanbul! Katerina & Victor

Reviews.Title: “loved the hanedan”
Reviews.Author: aussieasiaphile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for several nights in the Hanedan Hotel which must be the best value budget hotel in Sultanahmet.The staff were friendly and helpful,the room was quiet and the area could not have been better. The breakfast was excellent,and the view of the sea and Aya Sophia from the rooftop terrace was amazing. Don't expect a lift or room service,it's a bed and breakfast in an old Ottoman house after all,but for the budget traveller who wants a degree of comfort this place is tops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: GreatCanuck
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hanedan is located within a few minutes of the Hagia Sofia, and Suleyman was extremely friendly upon arrival. Breakfast is lovely on top of a terrace in view of the Blue Mosque and the rooms were very cosy indeed. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay.”
Reviews.Author: HEJ_Girls
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in a travel guide, and checked trip advisor for customer feedback. We had a lovely room, with a gorgous view. We found all of the staff friendly and helpful, including booking restaurants for us and giving detailed directions etc The only negative was the airport ransfer, where we were changed from a modern vehicle to a much older one, 10 mins into the journey for no obvious reason. This did not however detract from an overall good experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12380
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hanedan Hotel for a week towards the end of October 2008 and both really enjoyed our stay. Our room, while not having much of a view, had a lot of character, with lovely old-fashioned wooden floors. Showers etc were fine, with lots of hot water. The view from the breakfast terrace (inside and outside) was spectacular - the sea in one direction, Istanbul's Asian shore in the other, and the Sophia Hagia up the hill. The breakfast itself was served from 8 to 11 and was an excellent buffet - yoghurt, fruit, eggs, bread, cakes, juice etc. The lady serving was very friendly, and the atmosophere was very relaxed, with people contentedly enjoying the view and lingering over breakfast. The other hotel staff were very friendly and polite. The manager, Suleyman, was at pains to ask how our trip from the airport went, and was on hand to give us advice when we needed it and to banter about English and Turkish footballing success (or otherwise). The location was very good and very central, although it is in the middle of the touristy area, so it's worth travelling out from the hotel's immediate vicinity. When we were there, it was very quiet, although the walls/ceilings are rather thin as doors closing, babies, call to prayer at 5am from the nearby Blue Mosque etc can be heard. Overall it was great and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, Flexible, Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: bororo_eu
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and... what you don't manage properly, the guys will do for you... We did not do perfect planning: a few days before coming to Istanbul we realised that instead of one triple we would like a double plus a single. However, two separate rooms were only available from the 2nd day. So, we stayed one night all three of us in one room and next morning, we got an extra room... More about the rooms: they were really decent. Istanbul is not that kind of destination where you come to spend the day in the hotel room - so, the rather smaller size really does not matter - it is clean and so is the bathroom. Aircondition is efficient but switches off automatically, when you remove the key-card. The staircase is not very adorable, if you forget something in the room and you often happen to run up-and-down - but regarding luggage: the guys are very helpful and ready to help you with your heavy stuff. The location was perfect: from the terrace, you can see Aya Sophia - and you get there (or to Blue Mosque or to Topkapi Palace or, or, or...) walking in less time than a cigarette takes. A lot of night-life in the bars around - and our hotel was still in a quiet street. Finally, the breakfast: again - very decent. And with a very nice smile of the lady serving it. Even if you are on diet - go and enjoy fresh bread and her smile :-) Well, if you want to get value for your money - choose Hanedan. We would like to come back to Istanbul - and we would for sure come back to Hanedan.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Bliss”
Reviews.Author: MathUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed with three friends at the Hanedan. We stayed in one room which was clean and tidy and pleasant. The breakfast served on the roof terrace ios excellent and can last as long as you like......with views right across the Bosphorus it was superb. The host Suleyman was friendly and helpful. Location is ideal - a short way up a quiet street but right in the middle of Sultanamet. I would definitely go back - excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BugsyMalone
Reviews.Content: I had some business in Turkey and I invited the wife to spend a week in Istanbul after I was done. I selected a hotel in the Sultanahmet section of town because it had a website and I could reserve with a credit card. The Hamedan Hotel is in the thick of things and during the third week in April or so it becomes deluged with Aussie and Kiwi youth honoring ANZAC Day. I used to be younger but the debauchery and noise generated by the "pre-site visit" partying impressed even me. The Hamedan Hotel configuration doesn't allow for noise dampening and beer drinking and simple screaming at the top of one's lungs for hours and hours made me weary until it died off about 5:30 AM. The front desk help was aloof and less than helpful about moving rooms or locating other accomodations further from ground zero. If you go during ANZAC week remember to honor the brave men who sacrificed their lives at Gallipoli and book some other place further afield from the unbridled drunkeness.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Hanedan”
Reviews.Author: iVoyage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hanedan for almost two weeks and it was a pure pleasure. Hotel Manager Suleyman and his staff made sure that we we had nothing to complain about and made us feel like at home in an instant. The rooms are beautifully decorated and there is plenty of space. Breakfast is served on the terrace with a breathtaking view over Istanbul's Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the ocean. You may choose a traditional hearty or sweet breakfast, or have both if your stomach has enough capacities. The hotel is located in the central Sultanahmet area and all the famous places are literally only minutes away. Suleyman and his staff were always available for a friendly chat and helped us out with recommendations for the Istanbul area. Hotel Hanedan contributed a lot to our stay and memories of the city we will be thrilled to return when coming back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: DRSouthern
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hanedan in May. For value and location it can't be beat. The staff was friendly, the breakfast just fine and the room was big and had a view over a relatively quiet side street. The view from the roof top terrace is just great! I could see that it might be a little noisy on weekends in the summer, as there are a few late night coffee shops nearby...

Reviews.Title: “hanedan, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: xyzItaly
Reviews.Content: Hanedan hotel is exactly what we were looking for. A traditional house, refurbished with taste with a beautiful and romantic view on the Bosphorus / Marmara sea, perfectly situated close to the Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia and the Topkapi, in the middle of Sultanahmet. Our family room was clean, not large but very comfortable, and we had the final surprise at breakfast because the view from the terrace is breathless. We spent 6 nights there and enjoyed the position of the hotel, central, safe and with many restaurants. The hotel has also a pickup service from and to the airport at a convenient price.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy, but great for the price”
Reviews.Author: MankyMonkey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel/pension right in the heart of the historic Sultanahmet area. Couldn't be in a better location for seeing all the historic bits: Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia etc. Room - was fairly basic, but good size and completely clean. There were a few dent marks in the walls, shower cubicle had plastic sides and the curtains on the four-poster bed were attached with velcro - but for the price and location, these really are minor gripes. Booking online - was extremely easy, and the owner always replied to my emails the same day, in good English. Front desk was helpful and friendly, not quite so good at night, but still fine. Breakfast - very basic, but fine. Served on roof terrace, which has lovely views of Marmara and surrounding area. (Bread, butter, tea, coffee, olives? etc.) Location - On quieter side-street, off main tourist/hotel strip. However, there is a VERY loud bar at the back of the hotel - many of the rooms look straight into bar area about 2m away. Had to buy ear plugs and still couldn't block out the noise! Ask for a room on the street-side (or at least away from the bar at the back) to solve this. Getting there (from cheapo airport Sahiba Gokcen) - Hotel will organise Taxi from airport, or can get one easily once your there. (About â‚¬45) Was too steep for us - We got the Havas bus from outside the airport terminal - takes you to Taksim Square for 10YTL (around Â£4). Can walk in about 45mins from here, or a taxi's really cheap (about 12YTL) We got the tram from Taksim side of the river (15minute walk), that drops you in the main Sultanahmet square. (think it was just 1YTL - buy the ticket before you get on) Great bits to walk to from hotel: * Blue Mosque (free!) * Topkapi Palace (go really early as queues are mad) * Aya Sofia * Bazaar (just north of square) * Loads of Shisha and tea gardens (better one's are up towards the Bazaar) Overall a great budget hotel, the only reason I gave it 3* and not 4*, was our unfortunate room - looking straight into the noisiest bar in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Charming location in the historic part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SultanJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: I recently attended an academic conference in Istanbul, and my wife and I stayed for five days at the Hanedan Hotel in Sultanahmet, which is the historic centre of Istanbul, where the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace are located. Situated among other small hotels, the Hanedan is characterised by the charm of its position and the hospitality of its staff. It is adjacent to a cobbled and narrow street, along which numerous restaurants are situated, and these provide an animated and quaint environment until late evening. The hotel itself consists of only about twelve rooms, but these are distributed among four floors. A light breakfast, consisting of yogurt, fruit, eggs, cheese and olives, is served on the roof of the hotel, which provides a spectacular view of the Sea of Marmara, and of the Prince's Islands. This natural panorama is complemented by an extraordinary and fascinating array of sea traffic - tankers, yachts, liners and tugs - entering and leaving the Bosphorous. The rooms are modest and comfortable, providing the traveler working with a middle range budget (60 Euros per room per night) with a secure and restful base. The reception staff are courteous, informed and accommodating, and the catering staff both pleasant and obliging. Given the size of Istanbul, and the general pace of life and traffic within it, I would strongly recommend the Sultanahmet area in general, and the Hanedan Hotel in particular, as a pleasant and agreeable retreat for any traveler in this area.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gracelim7
Reviews.Content: Travelling in Turkey with 2 other gal friends have been an absolutely wonderful experience! This was further enhanced by our stay whilst in Istanbul, largely thanx to the amazing hospitality offered to us at Hotel Hanedan. Suleyman, the hotel manager, was extremely warm, friendly & helpful. Always at hand to give us suggestions & ideas on where to go, to help out at anything we might need. He even drew out little maps to give us a better sense of orientation & direction around the various areas! We also enjoyed some time spent chatting with Suleyman, learning more about turkey & its history & culture. As for our hotel room, it was comfortable with clean sheets & a good mattress. Am impressed too, by the level of cleanliness provided by the cleaning lady. Not forgetting the beautiful sea-view seen from the terrace, which can be used anytime of the day. The variety of food provided at breakfast was ample, with delicious home-made jam! A treat most definitely. All in all, a great stay! Will recommend it to anyone whoâ€™s looking for a hotel not just with an excellent location, but also, a great personable Turkish experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, safe, comfortable, affordable, friendly”
Reviews.Author: seeker
Reviews.Content: My 6th trip to Istanbul we stayed at The Hanedan instead of my usual selection, The Peninsula, The Hanedan's sister hotel across the lane, as they were booked solid. Suleyman, the manager of The Hanedan could not have been nicer. His professionalism and friendliness made us feel relaxed and welcomed. I was experiencing a problem with the wheel of suitcase, Suleyman dropped everything he was doing to fix it for me. Our room was sparkling clean, creatively decorated, with plenty of hot water. I gained an appreciation for those who work in the hotel industry. There were some guests at the hotel, from England, who exhibited loud and boorish behavior towards Suleyman, quite hostile in their manner. I have to say I admire the way Suleyman maintained his friendly composure in spite of the abuse he was subject to from some guests. I decided that Suleyman is the Dalai Lama of hoteliers, a very calm, gracious and patient man. The breakfast at the hotel was always excellent with the best yogurt I've ever eaten. Suleyman helped us immensely by providing some guidance in navigating the ferry system to Prince Islands. He even wrote down directions and instructions and showed great care and concern. I will always remember his professionalism, going the extra mile and his grace under pressure. I will always remember my comfortable stay at The Hanedan and hope to stay there again for my next Istanbul trip.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible Manager & Horrible Experiece”
Reviews.Author: slimjim043
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had booked a reservation at Hanedan Hotel excited that it was located in the middle of Sultanhamet, had excellent Trip Advisor Reviews, and apparently an excellent Manager named Suleyman. I had a health problem required hospitalization in Istanbul which lead to paralysis of both of my legs. Even though we explained the situation to Suleyman, he insisted that we pay for two nights stay. I even had my neurosurgeon write a note in Turkish and he did not budge. What was even worse was that he secured a new reservation for the second night for our room and still insisted on charging us. Think twice about booking Hotel Hanedan. I reccomend that you check out Hotel Sebnem or Empress Zoe.

Reviews.Title: “Female Traveling Alone - Pay for What you Get”
Reviews.Author: Shugga1
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Hanedan for two days before I arrived in Istanbul and was assured by Suleyman (hotel manager) via email that he would help me find a hotel for the rest of my trip given that I was traveling alone. He seemed both friendly and helpful over email, so I was excited to meet him in person. However, when I arrived I was not only disappointed in my room, but also in Suleyman's lack of interest in assisting a female traveling alone. Within the first hour when I arrived at the hotel, Suleyman was more interested in getting me to visit his friend the Travel Agent that he was in showing me where I could get a phone card to call home or where was the money exchanger. I politely went with him, hoping to get his assistance on finding a hotel for the remaining trip. Instead his friend, the travel agent, was both pushy and insisted that I leave Istanbul after my second day and take a bunch of trips elsewhere. I was hesitant given that I had just flown 13 hours to get there. Suleyman sat with me, but didn't say a word when I insisted that I wanted to stay longer in Istanbul. After the first day, I realized I wasn't going to get his help and found another hotel down the road. The room I was given faced a staircase that led to the terrace. To say the least I didn't sleep the first night as I was scared that someone would come into my room. He made me move down the stairs for the second day but it faced the staircase as well. The room was clean but my linens were ripped and looked rather worn-out. I tried taking a shower both nights at 10pm and there wasn't any hot water, so both times I had to call the front desk. They would then turn on the heating pump. Breakfast was the best part of my stay. Typical Turkish food comprised of olives, homemade bread, cheese, tomatoes etc. Finally, the hotel publishes that it has internet access, but it was really slow and barely worked while I was the there. I guess you pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerc2
Reviews.Content: Suleyman Karakus is the young friendly manager of the Hanedan hotel, who was only too happy to help out with local advice,tours and accommodation details. The hotel is very clean with modern bathroom facilities and double glazed windows for sound insulation. The free breakfast on the rooftop had great views over the Marmara Sea.Located close to the main sights such as the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, it was very close to the Sultanahmet area of restaurants,bars and travel agencies.A short walk brought you down to the Marmara Sea breakwall with a couple of nice cafes overlooking the water.I enjoyed my stay. Roger Cassar

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hanedan”
Reviews.Author: dms52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hanedan for 3 nights in May. As there were 7 of us, we needed 2 double rooms and a family room. All rooms were good size and very clean. The manager, Suleyman, was very nice and went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable. He also arranged tours and airport transfers for us at a very reasonable price. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable good value 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BladonOxford
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Hanedan. Can't thing of anything bad to say about it. The location is in the centre of Sultanhamet, 3 minutes walk from Aya Sofya and the Topapaki Palace in a pleasant area full of reasonable restaurants. It can be a bit noisy at night as there are several roof top bars nearby, but the rooms are double glazed which kept the noise out. Rooms were pleasant though fairly basic (as we expected for the price) and very clean, bathroom the same. There is a roof terrace with views of the sea where breakfast is served and which you can use in the evenings. My son used the internet computer in the lobby, which was a bit slow and couldn't access all sites for some reason - but hey, its free. We didn't try the wifi servvice. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful - Suleiman (the manager) has good English and is happy to help out with booking things if necessary. We used the airport pick up service, which worked fine, though I'm not sure if it was any cheaper than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite Turkish Delight but not Midight Express either !”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Carter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in April with a mate before catching the 36 hour ferry to Ukraine (thatâ€™s another story !). He had booked it on internet after reading earlier reviews. Place looked bright and cheerful from outside in an area of similar styled buildings. Reception area nice and staff at desk welcoming and helpful. We had a nice room on first floor, wooden floors and four-poster bed. Unfortunately the only way they could give us a twin room was to add a fold up bed alongside the double which made it a bit cramped. Bathroom clean with good shower. Some of the other rooms looked very nice and more spacious. Only disappointment was the breakfast. It was the usual fare of cold meats, cheese, fruit and bread which was fine except that the two waiting staff seemed to spend most of their time sleeping at one of the tables on our first morning so it was difficult to get drinks or any additional food. On the second day the staff were nowhere to be seen and we ended up with a bread roll and no drink. Roof top terrace where you take breakfast is OK and includes a covered area for the chillier mornings, as it was when we were there. View was mainly over rooftop terraces of other similar establishments although you could see the Sea of Marmara and the Haghia Sophia. Immediate area was good for late bars such as Just and Sultan which seemed to stay open as long as people were drinking. Popular with young backpackers trying to eke out their money on cheap(ish) beer and dope. Enjoyed exploring the city particularly the Galata Bridge, Tunel area, Nevizade Sokak to drink with the locals and some excellent bars in Kadife Sokak area, a short ferry ride across the Bosphorus. Grand bazaar worth visiting â€“ a lot less hassle than Marrakech but still easy to get lost. Found Turkish people very friendly â€“ the sister of a girl we sat next to on the plane even drove us from the airport to the door of the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kdi
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here for five nights in the first week of May.We stayed an additional night at the Hotel Peninsula right across managed by the same people The best thing that the hotel has going for it, is it's location . Most of the major sites in istanbul - The Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi palace, the archaeological museum, the Basilica Cistern, the hippodrome â€¦are a short walk away. We had requested an airport pick up, which much to our relief was there at the airport at the scheduled time. Our grouse if at all, is really with the room we stayed in. The supply of running hot water in the bathroom was iffly. The bidet gadget in the commode needed a lot of effort to turn on and turn off, a light bulb in the entrance was not replaced in spite of frequent reminders. The room at Hotel Peninsula on the other hand was much, much better and itâ€™s also cheaper. Having said Suleiman, the manager was very kind and helpful. The breakfast, served on the terrace was basic but adequate. The other staff was also very polite. So in sum, would I recommend this hotel ? Yes,but just make sure that the room that you get is to your satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Hanedan”
Reviews.Author: chearn73
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Hanedan Hotel to anyone and everyone who is heading to Istanbul. If it could be arranged, I would stay nowhere else BUT the Hanedan everytime I go to Istanbul! Suleyman Bey is the owner, and is such a nice guy. He's warm and personable. He suits his job to a T! He has a terrific staff on hand. It feels like staying at a friends house, not a hotel. The rooms are a nice size, spotless, comfortable and well renovated. The whole hotel, for that matter, is well maintained and a pleasure to spend time in. There is a modest terrace on the roof with a truly amazing view. Sultanahmet can be pretty overbearing at times, with touts always trying to drag people into their restaurants or carpet shops or leather stores. There can be an awful lot of shady characters who just see tourists as bank machines and not people. The Hanedan Hotel is an escape from all of that, and restores my faith that the travel industry has not been completely destroyed by dishonesty and swindling. I look forward to being able to spend more time at the Hanedan Hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MOF3
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Hanedan and I thoroughly enjoyed it both times. The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and reasonably priced. I've always had good experience with both my reservations being respected and any prearranged rides. While the hotel is really close to all the sites in Sultanhamet, as well as an easy walk to the Golden Horn, it's tucked around the corner from traffic. Thus the rooms are all relatively quiet for their location. Breakfast is good with great views from the rooftop deck and the staff is very helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a Budget Price”
Reviews.Author: SimonRufus
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay in the Hanedan Hotel in April 2008. Pros: Location. Youâ€™re about a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Also great views of the Hagia Sophia and Sea of Marmara. Youâ€™re route takes you past a corner convenience store where we stocked up on water and bottled pop for the day (and evening on the way back). Clean. We thought our room and bathroom were very clean. Price. I had booked a large double room months in advance and Suleyman honored my 55 euro rate (looks like itâ€™s increased now), with an additional 10% discount for paying in cash. So came to around $75 or so. Breakfast. Great views of the Sea and the Hagia Sophia on the rooftop terrace. Quite a spread for breakfast. Great bread, yogurt, honey, cheese, olives,....The breakfast is probably worth $7-$10 a person if you were to buy it on your own. Airport transfer. This was an additional cost, but well worth it. The driver was ready and waiting on our arrival, as well as ready to go for our early morning return trip to the airport a few days later. Cons: A bit noisy. We were in the Seljuk room, a large double room, one floor above street level, on the street. There was quite a noisy bar next door that was blaring American rock music during the late evening/ early nighttime. Luckily we had some earplugs. Perhaps one of the rooms off the street would have less noise. Shower. Though clean, youâ€™d get about 20 seconds of hot water, then 20 seconds of cold water, then maybe 10 seconds of really hot water. Luckily the shower had enough room to step away from the water, so you werenâ€™t caught in all the phases. Just kind of annoying. Bed. Bed was a little thin considering we could feel the springs in the mattress dig into my ribs when we slept. Our large room actually had a full/queen size bed and two twin sized beds as well. Each bed had a mattress pad type thing on them, so after the first night, we pulled the mattress pads from the other two twin beds and added them to our full/queen to provide some additional softness. That did the trick and after that, no complaints. Overall this place had some pros and cons, but itâ€™s a great budget hotel with a great location. I think the combination of the pros, price, location, and breakfast outweigh the cons. We would probably stay at the Hanedan again if we ever head back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: AuroraSky
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Hanedan Hotel - staying there helped to make my stay in the beautiful city of Istanbul a real holiday. It is a few minutes walk to many of the attractions and I found the staff very helpful. I was travelling on my own for most of my stay and I felt safe walking around (after I learned to say 'no' to those wanting to sell me something), and taking in the beauty of the city. While walking by the sea nearby, I discovered an outdoor gym for adults - amazing! This hotel was very inexpensive, right in the heart of everything. And I was able to take a bus to Taksim Square when I wanted a change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, friendly, safe, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: likeah
Reviews.Content: sooo EZ. made all arrangements online, excellant airport pick-up after the long flight. also stayed at Pennisula, sister hotel across the street, in april '08. the hotel staff is helpful, speaks english, always available ...they stored my extra duffle bag for 3 weeks while i was in central asia. this hotel is for travelers that like a home away from home. breakfast buffet up on the roof....inside or outside in the sun to the view of the bay. these hotels are within a couple blocks of a lot of must-see attractions, museums, cafes,shops and clubs. this is my choice whenever i am in istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed_M
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant experience at Hanedan hotel, where my wife and I stayed during our 1 week vacation to Istanbul. The location was perfect, less than five mins walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, and other popular tourist destinations. The rooms are clean and spacious and some rooms have a sea view. The staff were polite and friendly, making you feel very welcome. Breakfast is served on the terrace which is nice when it is warm outside. The breakfast is simple but satisfying. Also there is a computer downstairs at reception for guests to use, which has free internet access, great for anyone who wants to do some last minute searching on things to do on their stay in Istanbul or just to check your mail. The only complaint I have is that sometimes the noise from the surrounding bars can disturb your sleep. The window blocks out most of the sound but some can still be heard. Overall this did not affect our opinion of the hotel and we would still definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend staying @ Hanedan Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresofHoneyBee
Reviews.Content: Me and 2 of my good friends have just come home after a wonderful 7 days holiday spent at the city of Istanbul. We stayed at the Hanedan hotel which was conveniently located in the Sultanahmet district. We had a comfortable stay at the Hanedan hotel. We were picked up from the airport as promised. On arrival at the hotel, we were met with friendly staff who helped us move our luggage to our rooms. The rooms were tastefully decorated, comfortable and in a quiet residential area. Suleyman the co owner, his delightful beautiful sister, his mum and other staff were all attentive to our needs and met our requests with smile and nothing was a problem to organise. For anyone looking for decent middle range place to stay close to all the sights such as Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia and the Grand Bazaar, I would recommend staying at the Hanedan hotel. We enjoyed our stay and most people would.

Reviews.Title: “Rude desk clerk took away from nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: jstrickland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lacking in the service department during our stay, but the hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are big and well-decorated, the dÃ©cor is charming, and the location is great. Itâ€™s on a lively cobblestone street in Sultanhamet amidst many bars, clubs, and restaurants. My emails with the manager (or owner?) beforehand were good; he was very quick to respond and very courteous. Our problem began when we arrived at the airport and couldnâ€™t find the driver that had been promised (and confirmed the day before via email). We called the hotel from the airport and were assured the driver was on his way. Over an hour later, another man came and had us follow him to another terminal where we retrieved 2 other passengers and were finally taken to our hotel. The desk clerk never offered an apology and tried to make us pay for the ride. I argued with him and finally offered to pay half of the fare despite my anger at the inconvenience and having been treated so poorly. When I returned home I emailed the manager my disappointment and he very kindly apologized, promising to speak with the desk clerk. I hope he does; the hotel is too nice to be brought down by bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nordlys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the "Hanedan" for some days and it was a very positive experience: super close to all major sights in the historic heart of Istanbul and is easily linked to the other side of the Golden Horn and the Asian side. It has a roof terrace with a spectacular view on the Marmara Sea. Good breakfast and service. Overall very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for clean, quiet, functional lodging”
Reviews.Author: zaskar2ben
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hanedan Hotel for 5 nights in early March 2008 and had a fantastic experience. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. There a LOTS of small shops and restaurants literally right next to the hotel as well, so you can stay close if you'd like. We had 5 in our party (3 adults, 2 children) and were readily accommodated in one of the family rooms (Seljuk). The room was clean and functional - nothing fancy, but certainly not a dive. The bathroom was in great shape and was cleaned every day. Even with a few kids running around in the room, we felt like we had enough space. There is a computer downstairs with free Internet access (although it's pretty slow). Breakfast is like the room - functional but not overly fancy (tomatoes, cucumbers, cheese, olives, bread, yogurt, eggs, juice/coffee, etc.). The views from the terrace were great - Sea of Marmara was right in front of you and the Hagia Sophia dominates the other side of the terrace. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for cheap, clean, functional accommodations while staying in Istanbul, our new #1 favorite city!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: restlessfeetsyndrome
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and amazingly helpful. The room was excellent and so was the location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for this international vagabond!”
Reviews.Author: Braveheart1952
Reviews.Content: The Hanedan Hotel, is a small, simple, personalized place. The manager was exceptionally responsive by email. They arranged very reasonable transport from the Airport to the Hotel in Sultanhamet. My single room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast served on the rooftop garden overlooking the Bosphorus was nourishing. Having wireless internet was a real, plus, and all the staff were friendly and helpful. The location near within walking distance of all the great historic sites of Istanbul was super. I was also given a 10% discount for paying in cash. I will definitely stay at the Hanedan Hotel on my next visit to Istanbul, which will be my 6th time in that magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “So at home!”
Reviews.Author: JillD47
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hanedan early in the morning from Cairo and nothing was too much trouble for the excellent, friendly and accommodating staff, both then and for the rest of our stay. We loved the ambience, the location, the fabulous and sustaining breakfast and the relaxed feel of the place. We rebooked to return after a sojourn to Cappadocia and felt like family upon our return. This time we were lucky enough to have a really big room and were able to spread ourselves out prior to returning to Australia. One thing we did like was the feeling amongst guests that they could talk to each other and we made some good friends whilst there. We both felt that we would stay there again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bed and Breakfast location”
Reviews.Author: west10Shawnee_Kansas
Reviews.Content: The Hanedan Hotel is truly more like a Bed and Breakfast. Rooms are small, very basic, little creature comforts, like a coffee maker or sitting area to just sit and read. Bathrooms are fairly normal for US standards, again, nothing fancy. The Hotel is clean, breakfast is basic but nice, staff are helpful, WiFi not powerful enough to reach the top floor of Hotel. The bed is fairly basic too, but after all we did not go to Turkey just to sit in the room. For the price, the accomidations were just right. Not fancy by any means. Very nice roof top view of the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AceBuffe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 12 nights in Istanbul, Turkey. We were lucky to have found the Hanedan. The room was spotless, floors washed each day. The bathroom was quite large and shower large also. While the room was small the view was a life saver. The staff was extremly friendly and helpful. Advised good restaurants on two occasions. Airport pickup was as advertised. If you are on a budget and want clean, friendly, close to sites, and professtional service this is the place. All contact was via e-mail. They were willing to negotiate where other hotels were not. Give them a try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: vig2
Reviews.Content: Pat & Vig from England, We chose Hanedan on the basis of the review in the "Turkey - Lonely Planet Guide" and we were very happy with this choice. Our stay of 5 days was very pleasant, enjoyable and comortable. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful, warm, courteous, kind and friendly, and nothing was of too much trouble for them. In particular, Sulaeman, the Manager, was meticulous in every respect and it was a privilege knowing him. High quality breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace from where one could absorb the incredibly beautiful panoramic scenic views across the ocean. It is so peaceful on the roof terrace that one could spend the day relaxing and sun bathing. The room had a very pleasant Turkish style decor and furniture. Most of the famous tourist sites were about a 5 minutes walk from the hotel. We also loved to walk about in the area around the hotel, the cobbled streets with great eating places, Bazaars and shops, - calm after the hectic busy city. Even with all these attractive features the hotel was wanting in a user friendly lounge, TV, & coffee and tea making facilities in the room and a trouble free telephone. We highly recommend this moderately priced hotel for those who are seeking a comfortable venue to retire after a hectic day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NFDLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hanedan suited us really well: in the centre of Sultanahmet, the historic quarter of Istanbul, very close to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, but quiet - at least in November. Inexpensive, friendly staff, and clean large single rooms, with bathroom, safe box, internet access. But the best thing is the breakfasts served on the roof terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara - breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: englit
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the hotel in August, 2007 and had a generally positive experience. The location of the hotel is fantastic. We found the staff were courteous and friendly. Our flight arrived over an hour late, but the driver was waiting patiently for us. The desk staff answered our questions clearly and provided some useful suggestions regarding restaurants and transportation around the city. The deck overlooking the city and the sea was a wonderful place to start each day with a basic, but good, breakfast. Our room was fine. It was clean and well maintained during our stay. The bathroom was clean and modern. There was no fridge or television or anything like that, but why would you need them? I have two minor cavils: the mattress was very thin and quite hard on the bed; there was either a club or a noisy hostel next door which had some sort of party every night we were there. The music would be quite loud (enough to make sleeping difficult) until about 11 or 11:30 p.m. I don't know if all rooms would be affected the same way or if we were just lucky enough to be facing the "right" way. Anyway, the experience was a very good one overall and I would consider returning to the Hanedan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “memorable stay at the Hanedan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheerbliss
Reviews.Content: On my recent holiday to Turkey, I stayed for 5 nights at the Hanedan Hotel, at the recommendation of a friend, who had recently visited Istanbul. During booking, the hotel was very helpful and answered all of my pre-trip questions. They also provided transport to & from the airport at a very reasonable fee, much less than a taxi or other hotel shuttle services. My departure flight was changed last minute and I anxiously emailed the hotel from JFK Airport and upon my arrival to Ataturk Intl Airport, the driver was waiting with a sign with my name on it. My room was comfortable, clean and quiet, with private bath, desk, A/C, hairdryer, internet, safe & a tasteful decor. A delicious Turkish breakfast was included in the price & served on the rooftop terrace with amazing views of the Marmara Sea, Haghia Sophia & the Blue Mosque. The view at night is equally breathtaking with all the lights of the city. The best part was the location, which was convenient (close walking distance to all the sights) but situated on a quiet street in Sultanahmet, away from the crowds of tourists. The staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable about the area & they took care of all my needs, from my request for an extra blanket to arranging a cruise on the Bosphorus. When my flight to Fethiye was delayed for 6 hrs, I called them and they sent the driver back right away to pick me up. It was an excellent value with service on par with the larger hotels and they give a discount if you pay cash. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: magellan_2007
Reviews.Content: A beautiful little hotel in the midst of the Sultanahmed - the tourist center of Istanbul. We've stayed in the Hanedan for five days in a wonderful spacious room, went on a trip to Gallipoli and came back for three more days. The second room was even more spacious, and absolutely gorgeous. Our friend stayed in a single room that she was happy with. The rooms are also quiet and comfortable, with both air conditioning and central heating. The Hanedan has only 10 rooms, is run by a small staff of friendly English-speakers, offers a tasty breakfast combining Western and Turkish food, has wireless Internet (although the connectivity should be improved - it didn't reach our second room so we had to use it from the lovely furnished foyer). Breakfast is served on the roof level with a clear and lovely view of Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and the Sea of Marmara. Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the Topkapi Palace (the 3 main tourist destinations in Istanbul) are 5 minutes walking distance. The next street is full of restaurants. What made us come back to the Hanedan was its personal service. The staff, especially Mr Suleyman, went out of their way to help us around and organize trips. We really enjoyed the Hanedan.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MooseK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hanedan Hotel during our one week visit to Istanbul. Hanedan is located very close to all of the "must see" places in the Sultanahmet area. It has a terrific view of the Bosphorus, Blue Mosqe and Aya Sophia from the roof top, where you get your sumptous breakfast every morning. The rooms and bathrooms are especially spacious and very clean. The staff is very friendly and most importantly helpful. We would bug them very day about something or another and Suleyman and Hussein were just so helpful! I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul. - Ann

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with more beautiful people.”
Reviews.Author: smiletogether
Reviews.Content: Last summer, My friends and I (4 girls) stayed at Hotel Hanedan. When we arrived, all things had been arranged-clean bed sheets, fresh towels, and it's provided daily. The rooms are great with antique furnitures and the air conditioner. The hotel's in a good location, walking distance to the Sultanahmet tram station, Blue mosque, Aya Sophia, and other beautiful places. Excellent restaurants nearby, travellers got together and drank beers till late at night in a good atmosphere. The staff at Hotel Hanedan and Hotel Peninsula were so kind and friendly, they said hello every time they saw us, smiling. On the first day at Hanedan, I was just complicated because I didn't know what to do, but those kind and professional staff told me what to do, what to avoid, and where to go. They gave me valuable informations about history of Turkey or public transportations and so on. Great turkish breakfast is included on terrace, during the breakfast hours, the staff made me comfortable and pleasant with all their jokes. I spent 4 days at Hotel Hanedan, and that is the happiest time I've ever had. I recommend you to choose this hotel if you also want to have great memories. yuri

HotelInfo.Name: Hanedan
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik Caddesi. Adliye Sok. No/3, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
